Reviews.Title: “This place needs SERIOUS work!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie S
Reviews.Content: Wow, where do I begin? Stayed here this past weekend. There was an odor in my room, a spiderweb on the bathroom sink, stained bathroom floor and stained toilet bowl. The carpet had not been shampooed and there were no curtains. I complained to the front desk. They addressed the odor by spraying air freshener and the lack of curtains by nailing a blanket to the wall over the blinds. While I was not expecting this to be the Sheraton, I do expect cleanliness. They addressed the dirty bathroom floor by spraying and wiping. i did not see a mop anywhere. This hotel needs a THOROUGH overhaul before I can give them a decent recommendation. I will NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another stay in OC at Quality Inn Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: mmazz22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times. Some good ,some bad, some in between experiences. This was a good one. Room was nice. It was clean. I asked for adjoining rooms at booking time and they accommodated that. Thought the overall hotel itself was cleaner than years past and noticed more guys cleaning the grounds than I ever have. Found all house keeping crews to be very friendly. Front desk crew still not particularly friendly. Surfin betty's the outdoor par was fun but would have spent more time there if they took credit cards. But trip was good, weather fantastic and again the price and location of this property can't be beat. Proably will stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL !!!”
Reviews.Author: babs067
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for approximately 4 nights. From check in to check out, neither I, nor does my family have one complaint. We arrived a little early, our room was ready. Our room was exactly as described online with a preferance for a high floor, which was given. The room was clean, bright, spotless and comfortable. It was absolutely perfect. We had our privacy, yet we had everyone there if we needed something. Our housekeeper, who I believe was Rosalie, was very pleasant and kept us well stocked with extra towels, at our request!! WE LOVED IT AND PLAN ON STAYING WHENEVER WE COME BACK !! WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL, WE DON'T THINK YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED !! ( One suggestion would be for them to invest in or upgrade the luggage carts. They seem to be in need of an overhaul. )

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sharonMichigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the top penthouse from 8/11 to 8/18. 6 adults, 5 children. Beautiful view of the ocean and boardwalk out front, the Bay out back. Lots of room...full kitchen, washer/dryer, two bedrooms,two baths and several pull out couches (not the most comfortable, but fine for the kids). Daily maid service, very friendly and efficient. Had a situation with a leak in two of the air conditioners, but were taken care of promptly. Management and front desk staff accomodating and friendly. Stayed several years before in a regular ocean front unit (only 6 of us), but this was great and would not hesitate to stay again. 24 hour coffee/tea in the lobby along with daily newspaper and fruit at the front desk. Pools were very clean and ocean right out your front door! Kids loved every minute of this trip and will remember their trip to the Ocean, since we are from Michigan (the Great Lakes state) for a long time to come!!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach”
Reviews.Author: Gary B
Reviews.Content: Second year staying at this hotel, location can't be beat. A short walk on the boardwalk to the arcades yet far enough away from all the noise and large crowd. The hotel can use some updating but overall our stay was enjoyable. Staff is as helpful as they can be, sliding doors that stick and small pillows won't stop us from staying here again. The bar at the pool is also a positive.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: NYKlin
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous after reading the reviews but to my surprise it wasn't bad. Yes it needs updating (Furniture, sliding doors, windows) but like someone else.....what do you expect being right on the beach with the surf, sand, etc. The bathroom was remodeld slightly and everything was in good working order. The place was clean and that is what's important to me. The staff was very helpful. (I had to have a phone delivered and there was no problems). Overall the location was perfect and had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomidating”
Reviews.Author: divinepwr
Reviews.Content: I hate giving this hotel a gleaming review.. I feel like it is my secret, lol! We have stayed here for the past four years, and it is always a great experience! The rooms are reasonable and spotless, the outdoor and indoor pools are such a great amenity, and the staff are fantastic! My all time fave OC hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Family oriented hotel right on the boardwalk.”
Reviews.Author: twocapemay
Reviews.Content: If you have kids & don't mind paying $350 a night for a $100 a night room, this is the place for you! The location couldn't be more perfect if you want your typical family beach vacation. The hotel has everything you need to keep the kids happy. 3 pools, easy access to your room, kitchenettes, right on the beach, plenty of vending machines, great location for shopping. The rooms are spotless & the front desk staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay on the Boardwalk with the Ocean outside your door!”
Reviews.Author: Disneyorl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the 3rd week of July 2012 for a short stay. I went with my parents who wanted to get away for a few days. Our room was on the first floor pool side and it was a great room with a deck and a glass door and sliding screen. We also had an ocean view. The room was outdated but most importantly was clean considering this would be a heavily used room at the beach. Had a small kitchenette that was furnished but we only used the refrigerator. This hotel definitely is a good place to stay with being located on the boardwalk. The boardwalk tram goes by frequently so if you don’t walk long distances this is an excellent option. Hotel is real close to a pizza shop on the boardwalk in case you get a late minute hunger for pizza, like we did. We enjoyed our stay here and would come back. My suggestion is to stay here if there is an urge to go to Ocean City. A negative is that you can hear the glass sliding door open and shut each time from the room above us which became annoying since they were in and out a lot. I do agree also that the price for staying is expensive but we know this is a convenience to be located on the boardwalk with an ocean right outside the door, plus this is the areas busiest time of year to make money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean!”
Reviews.Author: WvCarl
Reviews.Content: Arrived Sunday afternoon, was available for early check in, (1pm) Pleasantly suprised when we entered the room, Very spacious and clean. Beautiful view from the balcony. The boardwalk and beach are just outside the door. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Larlars109
Reviews.Content: Went here for a short weekend trip & we were upgraded to an oceanfront room at no charge. Door lock was broken & within minutes of our call to the front desk, someone was up to fix it. Great location, quiet, yet within walking distance to the attractions & inlet. Will definitely stay here again....a bit pricey, but in O.C., what isn't!!??

Reviews.Title: “10th Wedding Anniversary/Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jwruss71
Reviews.Content: This was first visit to Ocean City, MD and the location was great!The hotel is not cheap but it's located right on the boardwalk and overlooks the beach. The two large outdoor pools/sun deck areas, room was large in size and clean and offered beautiful views of the beach & boardwalk. There is also an outside bar located by the pool area where you can order food and a restaurant near the pool area overlooking the beach and boardwalk where we enjoyed a wonderful breakfest each morning. When we return to Ocean City, MD we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Eastern Shore Hotel(''nuff said)”
Reviews.Author: martingiles
Reviews.Content: I haven't been to the Eastern Shore in 30 years. Prior to that I was a regular visitor to the beaches in New Jersey, Delaware, and Maryland.That said, I thought this hotel was no better or no worse than anything I'd seen in my early days. It is as clean as it can be with three months worth of entire families tromping in and out of it without there feet completely free of sand. The rugs have a few stains from the distant and recent past (drunks and kids).The bathrooms are just bathrooms, alittle rust spot on the outside of the "blue" tub, but still clean. Beds were OK, and old style 27" TV worked as did A/C. Sofa bed was clean, not stained, not threadbare. Kitchen was functional and complete,more or less. Staff was as friendly and helpful and the room was quiet at night. Hotel has 3 relatively clean pools(2 out, 1 in) and good location on the beach/boardwalk. My point is, if you're looking for the Ritz, this ain't the place, BUT, if what you need is a place to sleep, eat, bath, and hang your swimsuit in something approaching comfort then this might be a good fit for a couple of days. (we paid $215/night for 4 nights in the last week of June, reserved 3 months in advance). I priced others that might have been more luxurious at $300 to $400/night. Maybe they are, maybe not..............

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: 43day
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend at the Quality Inn. The location was excellent and the ocean view was great. Two complaints- mattresses were pretty worn and I did not like the location of air conditioner/heater. The suite could be sectioned off from the sofabed and bedroom, but the ac unit was located on the sofa bed side. There was no vent on the bedroom side so if you close the divider you lose your air. Not good when it's 90 degrees outside. Two pretty nice sized outdoor pools and an indoor are on the premises. Don't forget to hit the happy hour at the outdoor bar and the 9 flavors of daquaries.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BrianB759
Reviews.Content: Based upon the pictures on the web, we were hopeful for more, but yet not surprised when the room turned out to be about what you would expect for a Quality Inn, despite the $300+ rate/night. In other words, nothing fancy AT ALL. The room was pretty big, (#203), with a huge balcony overlooking the Boardwalk (which was the best part of the room). Not sure how clean the rug was. The kitchenette was stocked with the bare minimum (bring your own knife if you need anything beyond a table knife). Bathroom was functional, but hadn’t been updated for a long time. Room is ok for the shore. Good location. Bloody Mary at the restaurant downstairs is very good (jalapeno flavored vodka).

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeb831
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Quality Inn during the third week of June this year and had a great time staying at this hotel and a great time in Ocean City! Staying on the 4th. floor with an oceanfront room allowed us to watch the dolphins in the morning before heading down to the pool and to comfortably sit on the private balcony in the evenings to relax and watch the people on the boardwalk and beach. An added bonus was that there was a screen door to the balcony, allowing us to keep the door open on the cooler nights to listen to the waves as we fell asleep. The room was very clean as was the bathroom, and the towels were plentiful. The full service kitchen gave us the opportunity to make breakfast each morning and to sit out on the balcony to enjoy it. As far as service goes, it was excellent. One night we asked for additional coffee and within minutes housekeeping arrived with what we had asked for. On another occasion, something went wrong with our tv. Upon calling the front desk, within 10 minutes of calling we had that tv replaced with another working tv....awesome service! Parking was excellent as was the midway location on the boardwalk, allowing us to have some quiet and use the tram when we wanted to visit the busier end of town. You also have the opportunity to enjoy 2 pools right on the boardwalk where you can still see the beach and ocean, We also ate our lunch at the food stand located between these pools on several days of our stay and the food was great and convenient. We would, without reservation, recommend your staying here for your visit to the beach!

Reviews.Title: “great locations:)”
Reviews.Author: simmonsx6
Reviews.Content: Went here twice for Cheerleading Nationals, in February, weather was very nice, great hotel, very helpful,girls loved the pool:)

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back.”
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here for our 4th wedding anniversary but we won't be back. The first disappointment was how the light switches didn't work, each lamp had to be turned on by hand. Why have light switches in a room if they don't work, plus waking into a dark room is never good. The 2nd disappointment was how hard and uncomfortable the bed was. The 3rd disappointment was how filthy the coffee maker was, the hotel staff did clean us for us on our 2nd day though. Also on our 2nd day was our disgusting breakfast, the toast, eggs and coffee were okay but the sausage and potatoes were pore enough to make us afraid to eat there again. The greatest offense was how I left a shirt in my room and despite two phone calls and an email, they were "unable to locate it'. I used to work retail computer reapir for five years and I can't imagine disposing of a customers property without making at least one effort to contact them. The only good thing that I have to say about them is that the pools and hot tub were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Will go again”
Reviews.Author: relaxNanne
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable beds. Slept well here. Little bit dirty, but not terrible. Right on boardwalk, nice pools.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean front views, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sonya N
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went away for the weekend just the two of us and we stayed in the king bed room with kitchenette and oceanfront views from private balcony. The oceans views are awesone. Our room was cleaned and stocked everyday by the friendly staff. We were never bothered by the cleaning staff during our 4 day stay. They came and cleaned our room while were out and we came back to a clean well stocked room. It was great! We loved the on premises restaurant and bar. It was great food and very convenient. We will definetly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Mark F
Reviews.Content: We booked a quick mid-week preseason getaway to Ocean City in May, 2012. We stayed in room 809, which was a very large, spotless, king bed room with kitchenette and balcony overlooking the pool, boardwalk, and with direct views of the ocean. The room was comfortable and had nice touches, including good TV channels, an in-room safe, and nice toiletries. The bathroom was small but recently re-tiled, and the kitchenette had a 4-burner stove, full-size fridge, dishwasher, and settings for six. We loved sleeping with the sliding glass door open, listening to the waves crashing on the sand all night. Friendly staff. Hot tub and in-door pool. Fitness center. Free coffee. Some might say the hotel is older, but we saw it more as retro. Try a drink at the boardwalk-side cafe during happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “No heat...”
Reviews.Author: otsthedog
Reviews.Content: I'll start off with my complaint --- the room was freezing --- around 60 degrees. I fiddled with the thermostat for a few minutes and then debated whether I wanted to request a different room. I had already settled in and didn't want the inconvenience of moving. But, finally, I decided I couldn't get a comfortable night's sleep and would have to move. I called downstairs to let them know that the heat wasn't working --- only the AC. They told me that the heat was switched off for the entire building but, I could have extra blankets or a space heater. I took both -- and, it was a good thing -- the space heater took eight hours to get the room up to 70 degrees. If not for this experience, the rating would be 3 stars - average. My room had outdoor access leading to an old room. It was actually kind of quaint how old it was. The bathroom had a blue sink and blue toilet. Everything was old in my room. It was clean. I had a full kitchen - microwave, full sized fridge, stove/oven & dishwasher. Two queen bed and a sofabed. In adequate lighting. I also had a balcony that overlooked the hotel next door, but, looking off to the right, I could see the beach and ocean. Coffee and tea were available 24 hours in the lobby as well as being available in the rooms. Newspapers included WSJ, USA Today & the Baltimore Sun. Coke machines were a bargain at 40 cents. Corridors were dark. Parking was free. There's an indoor pool and hot tub. The staff was helpful - front desk clerk efficient and maintenance guy that brought the space heater was friendly (maybe overworked with delivering space heaters to all the hotel's guests?). Overall, I would suggest staying here when you can be sure that the HVAC is operating appropriately and location is important.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: hikercharles
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in April, and there was a mix-up with my online reservation, so the front desk clerk upgraded me at no cost. The room & building was very clean, and overall I enjoyed my stay. The balcony had a great view of the Atlantic Ocean & over the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: As1225
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending the weekend there. Decent hotel and good service. The first day we got there, it was 81 degrees and a little warm. You don't expect that in March, so when we got to our room on the 6th floor, it was very stuffy. The thermostat didn't work and we were told that the entire hotel is run on one thermostat. Because the weather was going to be a little cooler next week, they might have to use the heat then and they can't switch back and forth between the two like that. The positive out of that was they brought up a fan for us right away. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Our room was very clean and recently renovated. Big bathroom also.

Reviews.Title: “We Liked It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thegrumpy-one
Reviews.Content: We had never been to the east coast before and had never seen the atlantic ocean. We were staying at Quality Inns for the points. We were so happy to find this Hotel. We had a kitchenett and enjoyed our 5 days there. The room was large and comfy, and had a nice view of the ocean. The service was excellent and the staff went out off there way to be helpful. Altough they don't tell you, but down stairs at the desk they always had a large bowl with fresh fruit. We REALLY enjoyed our stay there. P.S. The Pacific Ocean is prettier!!

Reviews.Title: “Hit or miss”
Reviews.Author: T84A
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times, primarily in the spring or fall. You cannot beat the location. The most important thing to keep in mind is that there are two distinct sections of this hotel. If you get a room in the newer section, all is good. If you end up with a room in the older section, you definitely will not be happy. Make sure you get a guaranteed room in the new section.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DustyKitty
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here both off-season and during the summer for many years. The location on the boardwalk is excellent, the entire facility is clean and well-kept, and the staff is amazing. Love the oceanfront balcony, the kitchen amenities, both of the oceanfront pools, and the fabulous indoor pool. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay January13th thur January 15th, 2012”
Reviews.Author: Barb L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the weekend had a fabulous time we stayed on the 4th floor room 402. The hotel staff was wonderful. The room was clean. Fresh towels daily.Hot Tea and Coffee in the lobby. Soda machines and candy machines on the side lobby. Pool, Hot tub, exercise room. Everything looked great. Rates were great. Thanks to the wonderful staff there at Quality!!! We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value room on the ocean!”
Reviews.Author: KebbieK
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here during the off season and for under $70, you feel like you have hit the jackpot! Comfortable beds clean and the kitchen amenities are great! The best feature is truly the location. You can't best sitting on the balcony with the roar of th ocean waves ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome bang for your buck.”
Reviews.Author: slick70gto
Reviews.Content: I can not even begin to tell everyone how well mannered and helpful the staff was during our stay. the restuarant and lounge were excellent as well. the rooms were well kept and the cleaning staff was top notch. the Quality Inn made our entire golf vacation trip a super and unforgettable time. we will definitely be coming back here for years to come. It is a great family, couples and group hotel t ostay at. right on the ocean and boardwalk clsoe to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Our yearly fall motorcycle trip to OC”
Reviews.Author: Greg L
Reviews.Content: We look forward every year to our trip to OC in the fall. Staying at the Quality Inn on 17th street has become part of that tradition. They consistently have great room rates, spacious rooms and the rooms have always been clean; that's outstanding considering how many years we have been staying there. The Inn is located within perfect walking distance of downtown. The Ocean View Grill located in the Inn service great food and our specialty is the breakfast which we always look forward to before our walk down town. It's just a great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “We were so lucky!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia L
Reviews.Content: We came to OC to run in a fall race and found a great deal on a room at the Quality Inn. Had no idea what to expect. It was fantastic. Amazing oceanfront view and fantastic staff. Good size room and bathroom and nice living and full kitchen areas. Would highly recommend. Just sorry I didn't have time for pool/ hot tub!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ron B
Reviews.Content: Clean spacious OCEANFRONT...stove, clean, comfortable beds...quiet even during BIKE WEEK...good staff...rooms thoroughly clean EARLY...looks drab from streetside balcony, but great once you go inside...LARGE bathroom!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the Haters”
Reviews.Author: NyVioletcat
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying at the Quality Inn Boardwalk for a number of years now. We have gone to other places from time to time, but always came back. The oceanfront efficiency rooms are great, plenty of room, always clean, as is the bathroom. The ocean views are breathtaking. Watching dolphins frolic from your room balcony in the morning is a wonderful way to start your day. As for price, I think the rooms are reasonable for a property on the ocean. The Jersey shore and other places are much more expensive during the high season, as are the Rehoboth hotels. And the oceanfront rooms are tiny. The only negative for us has been the restaurant. Very slow service every time we have been there, though the food is okay. I plan to stay here next summer as well.

Reviews.Title: “False ad- total crap!!”
Reviews.Author: myhaleybug
Reviews.Content: NASTY!!!!.....DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Yes, many of the hotels in OC are older, but many have done updates to stay with the times. The photos on the website are so misleading. First off, our door barley closed which made us feel so safe..(NOT) and of course we had to have a drunk man banging on the door at 2am trying to get in swearing it was his room....great, we have a strong drunk man slamming into the door that is barley closed to begin with!! Then we walked into the room and noticed how old everything was, the couch and chair were falling apart, the two beds didnt even have bedskirts on them, exposing the nasty dirty ripped up boxsprings. When I complained to the front desk, I was told that "not all rooms come with bedskirts". Notice that the website does not have photos of the bathroom...thats becasue they are smatter than that. The bathroom has blue tiles from the 1970's and is falling apart. Our stay was middle sept. and a cold front came through. We couldnt get the heat to work so we once again called the front desk...only to be told that "heat wasnt available this time of year". I expressed my anger as it was to drop into the 40's that evening and I was told that they could bring me extra blankets...REALLY!!! It's freezing and raining and I cant use the heat!! Indoor pool was not heated! Even the hot tub was just a little hot. Parking is limited to one spot, yet the room holds four people, so I'm sure I'm not the first to want a second spot, which of course I was told that I couldnt get yet it was bike week and there were motorcycles in every inch of the parking lot....on the sidewalks...under the car port which was only to be used for drop off and pick up, so obviously we couldnt even pull our car up to pick up otheres in our party during the rain storms. Toliet paper and tissues are cheap, thin and rough. Tv is from the 1990's and barley works. Good luck getting on the elevators, they work half the time. This was a $200 a nite room that looks like a $79.99 a nite room. BAD, BAD, BAD!!! you've been warned..DONT TO IT!!

Reviews.Title: “our yearly trip”
Reviews.Author: Tammy B
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here the last 3 years and loved it! Yes, it is a bit outdated and i do have to agree it is expensive. However, it is clean which is very important to me and the staff is excellent. I have never had any problems and every year we ask for the same room and get it no problem. We did have to stay one time during off season on the 1st floor and yes it was noisy but, we just were as noisy and laughed it off. The convenience of the location of the hotel we also love. We walk or drive our bikes everywhere. We always had good food & good service at the Oceanview and great drinks at the outside bar. I highly recommand. We always have an oceanview room and it's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Good”
Reviews.Author: wildcat48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for our Motorcycle Club Convention, Sept. 8-11, 2011. This hotel is average. It needs some updating though. It has a pool, which was NOT heated and a hot tub. The game room consisted of 4 games. The workout room has about 5 machines which all seemed broken. We ate breakfast at the oceanview grill, which is in the hotel. AWEFUL!! Do not eat there! The hotel has 2 outdoor pools, which we did not have time to go in. They have a bar right on the boardwalk, which was ok. We had some meetings in the Penthouse, which was also nice, but needs updating. The maids and people at the check in desk were all friendly. Overall we had a nice stay. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “MUCH NEEDED VACATION”
Reviews.Author: Terri S
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that we have stayed at the Quality INn Boardwalk and after reading some of the reviews I was a little worried but I can tell you that all of my worries dissappeared the minute I stepped into the hotel. The room was fantastic and so was the view from the 9th floor. People complained about small pillows but you had 4 pillows per bed and after sleeping on them they were perfectly fine. Even the refrigerator was on and cold when we got there with our groceries, some hotels turn off the refrigerators and when you want to put stuff into them, they are warm. The only little problem that we had was that the dishwasher in our room leaked a little. We were having trouble with the DVD player not working, callled the front desk and someone was up to our room to fix the problem within 10 minutes. It would also be nice to have an ice machine on each floor, when we needed ice we had to go to a different floor or the lobby. But the excercise did us good. Any time we needed extra towels all I had to do was ask and they were there. The in-door pool was a little chilly but the hot tub was perfect. Every employee we dealt with was more than helpful. I hope to always stay at the Quality Inn and next year we are planning a large family vacation and hope that we will be able to all get rooms together .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Hotel - not so much!”
Reviews.Author: sumrflwr72
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving, the room was clean and you can tell the bathroom had been updated. Great ocean view! For a family of 4, the room was big enough. Kitchen supplies adequate. The indoor pool and the hot tub were ok, but the outdoor pools could definetly use some much needed love and maintenance, expecially the larger outdoor pool. The hotel staff appeared to have no knowledge of the area and couldn't assist with any area questions. During our stay our safe malfunctioned. After waiting over 45 minutes for maintenance they corrected the problem. During our stay our tub had a draining issue, followed by our toilet backing up. Mainentance came to look at the problem, but had to call for outside resources. Once the plumbers came they literally had to remove the toilet to fix the issue. They said this was a typical drainage problem throughout the hotel. They mentioned that the toilets keep clogging because the hotel staff keep flushing the old soap down the toilet. It took over 2 hours for them to fix the problem. In the meantime they sent us to the room next door to use the bathroom as those guests had not checked in. That room also had the same drainage issue as it was connected to our bathroom. Once they fixed our problem theirs was also fixed as they were tied together. Overall the location was great. The maintenance staff that fixed the plumbing issue were very professional. The hotel staff overall couldn't give a crap.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back !”
Reviews.Author: kingsley h
Reviews.Content: We have been a guest many years and greatly enjoy our every visit.

Reviews.Title: “What Dump”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn M
Reviews.Content: I paid prime dollars to stay in what I feel was a very low class hotel, a total of $726.00 for a 3 day stay. The staff at this facility does not know the meaning of customer service. The general impression was they could really have cared less what problems we experienced. We had no internet service and were given 3 different sets of direction on how to gain access and one even said we could go over to use the Holiday Inn’s computer next door. Of Hello, I think not! The manager expressed it was not promised but an amenity. I have not stayed in a hotel in years that did not offer free internet service to its customers. The ice machines were broke on most floors; the room was not clean at all. It was so bad I bought cleaning supplies and cleaned my own room. I will never ever stay in this facility again and will make sure I tell all I know there is no customer service and it is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of locking balcony door!”
Reviews.Author: Travelqueen8882
Reviews.Content: We like this hotel for the location and the balcony looking out over the boardwalk and the ocean. On this trip we checked in and immediately went to the balcony only to have the door lock behind us and we were stranded on the balcony without a cell phone or anyway to get in. Luckily after some yelling our neighbor called the front desk and they came and got us. Good hotel for the location and view. Rooms and locks are a little wacky.

Reviews.Title: “so so this trip”
Reviews.Author: mmazz22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and it has been wonderful the last few times. i really hesitate to gripe at all as i am so grateful my trip was wonderful despite the ominious irene on her way. But I will just say a few things. Walked in room and it stunk so bad. Had a musty ,mildew order. We went to desk and they sent something up and that was to take nasty odors away. Worked a little. Our room keys did not work in the beginning. My buddy and I had to go down to the desk 15 times before they finally fixed the key thing and even with that ,it took 6 swipes for the keys to work. This was very very annoying. The wireless internet in our room was terrible to compared to our friends room 2 doors down. This was annoying. Also found the front desk staff rude and the maintance staff very rude as well. I expect in a hotel friendly faces and greetings when they walk by customers. The cleaning staff though always greeted us with smiles, but not the European cleaning staff. They were rude too. Now the good the weather was great. The location to me is the best in town. The view is great. The price is right. If this hotel is still a good deal next year Ill stay again. Basically after this trip my loyalities are to this place due to the price.

Reviews.Title: “We will never go back there again”
Reviews.Author: lagrone d
Reviews.Content: The room was dingy and dirty. We were bitten by bugs. I did not know what they were until I got back home. I thought thet may have been spiders or mosquitos but they were not. Went to the ER because even with cortisone cream and benadryl they were not getting any better, they in fact got worse. The ER told me they were "BED BUG BITES". Had to be treated with prednisone. On top of that I had to throw out our suitcases to ensure they were not in there. It is very lucky for us that I always unpack as soon as I get home and put the clothing in the wash or we may have them here. I will never ever stay there again and I suggest no one else does.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: HLVTravel
Reviews.Content: I've read some of the other reviews and I'm not sure where those folks stayed, but this place was a real dump. First of all, the room I thought we were getting is not what we got -- no king bed, no curtain separator (which was why I chose this hotel -- to create a separate space for our toddler to nap uninterrupted). While unpacking, my little guy discovered someone else's clothes (including men's underwear and socks) in the room. Gross! We went down to the desk and they changed our room, and even sent someone to re-clean and recheck it for us. And she found flip flops from the previous occupant (and missed the chunks of orange cracker my son found later -- ugh!) -- seriously, do they not actually clean the rooms? Anyway, the bathroom was very outdated, had mildew, a poorly functioning toilet, a leaky ceiling in the tub, and rusty sink area. I've travelled a decent amount and this is the first time I've felt compelled to wear my flip flops in the shower. The whole please seems outdated, but also dirty and rundown. I've seen other rooms when they're being cleaned between stats and it looks like some have gotten some updates, some not. It's a crap shoot I wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible....stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia P
Reviews.Content: AC did not work....hotel manager refused to believe there was a problem, yet thermostat was reading 80 degrees. They attempted to fix the problem by giving my family a big noisy fan. Will never stay there again....toilet was messed up when we got there and sprinkler outside hotel on boardwalk were broken.

Reviews.Title: “Uncertain, but probably wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: judyhoff
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 8th floor of the Quality Boardwalk beginning on Monday and leaving on Thursday. Advice: Never start your stay on a Monday in August. It was horrible. Cars were everywhere. There was no parking. There were no employees to assist incoming guests with their luggage. To top it off luggage carts were non-existent and there was only one elevator working. And it was hot!!! I am disabled and came with my family. There were 4 handicap parking spots for a hotel this size. Not impressed at all. If it hadn't been for a young girl who works there who offered to help me I think I would have just cried....it was that bad. In my estimation this hotel had two things going for it...location and clean, comfortable beds. The bathroom was clean but the tub drain was clogged and shower water backed up. I got tons of tissues and dug it all out...gross, but it fixed the problem. The tub mat looked disgusting. Why they kept it is beyond me. The kitchen needs updating to say the least, especially the stove. Couldn't get the small table to open up to accommodate usage, so the kids ate on the balcony, which they loved, and we sat on the beds. The 8th floor maid was very nice and helpful. Wish I knew her name as she was a bright spot in the trip. The curtains were a disaster. They were dirty and torn on the ends, but worked. Maybe it's just me. Maybe I expect too much after paying close to $1000 for 3 nights in an oceanfront hotel. I spent about the same amount the previous week at an oceanfront hotel not on the boardwalk. It had bellmen, valet parking, clean rooms, and a beautiful oceanfront view. Hmmm.... We ate at the hotel restaurant and enjoyed it. The food was good as was the service. Checking out went better than checking in, as we moved the car to a vacant handicap spot earlier in the day.

Reviews.Title: “It is our "Choice" to stay there every year! Wouldn't stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ellen B
Reviews.Content: We stay in the oceanfront rooms, love the balcony, oceanview, and listening to the waves. Kids love the sofa bed to watch TV and shut the curtain so it doesn't disturb anyone else. Especially love the cleanliness of the pool and the atmosphere. Restaurant and beach bar so convenient and reasonably priced for families. Feel secure there, a big plus for me!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it will stay here every year”
Reviews.Author: hollifrye
Reviews.Content: hotel was clean the staff was pleasant and helpful the pools were great our kids could play with out getting hasseled.. The oceanfront room was spectacular the beds were very comfortable and clean and pillows were nice.We will stay there every year.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating and nice place”
Reviews.Author: ChrisRide
Reviews.Content: Booked the the Quality Inn on 16th Street and Boardwalk at the last minute during 4th of July week when the Courtyard by Marriott on 15th would not honor a special rate deal. The front desk folks at Quality were great and very accommodating and were able to get me an oceanfront room with a large balcony. Although, they did not offer a government rate, they gave me a 30% off promotion deal which made the rate very reasonable. The room was a decent size with a good sized bathroom along with a full size refrigerator, microwave and stove. Everything was very clean. The maid service was excellent and consistent. The beds were comfortable and the place provided a quiet night's sleep. The restaurant was a great choice for a good, fast breakfast and even had a buffet offering. The 2 outdoor pools were refreshing and faced the boardwalk and an outdoor bar was between them which was very convenient. Also, there was a very nice indoor pool with a huge hot tub with a waterfall. The amenities were awesome and really rivaled the Courtyard. I'm glad that I ended up at the Quality Inn and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but still had its downfalls.”
Reviews.Author: HannahC8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality Inn with my family for vacation. We've been visiting Ocean City for five years now, and this was the best hotel we've stayed at. But, like every hotel on the planet, it has its bad qualities as well as good. I'll start with the good first: -great location, great view -nice footwashing station was a plus -multiple (clean!) pools to choose from if one was full, indoor pool open late for those of us with busy days! -clean rooms -safes for important things i dodn't want to take to the beach -clean bathrooms (a MUST for me) -yummy food at the bar -easy checkin And now, the not so good: -shady, old couches in the lobby -yucky bathmats in the shower -decieving hotel doors (they make it look like you'll be staying in a dump) -terrible maids (for example, they get annoyed with you when your schedule doesn't fit with theirs and you ask them to come back later. also, they seemed to never have any towels, and needed to come back later to bring them. and the third day, while i was sick in bed with my family at the beach, a maid knocked on the door, but i couldn't get out of bed to tell her to go away because i was so ill, so she just barges in and starts cleaning like i'm not even there!!!! that made me mad, because i had to deal with some strange foreigner witness me writhing in pain and dry heaving, and when i asked her to leave, she responded with 'but i clean!'. they can't even understand english!) that's really all i can think of, but overall it was a nice stay and a terrific vacation(:

Reviews.Title: “3 stars for partial oceanview, 5 stars for oceanfront.”
Reviews.Author: LZaring
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in July 2011. The location was great; right on the boardwalk and easy access to the beach. We have 3 kids ages 4 and under and this was a great selling point for us. There are 3 pools, 2 outside and 1 inside. This was very nice as well because you can go to the pool to get the sand off of the kids before heading back to the room. There is a small bar and grill in the middle of the property and you can take the drinks to the pool with you (great for parents, too!). There are 2 showers out front to hose of the sand as well. Another great selling point is the public bathrooms on the first floor (great for small kids who have to go to the bathroom the second you get down to the beach!) We had a partial oceanview room. It was actually a great view for us, but the room was not anything luxurious for what we paid. Antiquated bathrooms, a sufficient kitchenette, bedroom 'area' and a small and outdated couch and TV area completed our room. Rooms were pretty clean, just not fancy by any stretch!! My in-laws stayed in an oceanfront room and it was MUCH nicer than ours. They were apparently redone in 2010, but not the rest of the property. I wish we could have afforded to stay in one of those rooms and then I would have given this hotel 5 stars...but for $60 more a night it was not in our price range.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: RavensFan1234
Reviews.Content: Quality Inn Boardwalk in Ocean City was a great pick for our mini-vacation. It has a great location - right on the boardwalk. There are 2 outdoor pools and 1 indoor pool, not to mention a poolside bar right next to the boardwalk. The room was great (oceanfront) with a well-equipped kitchenette. The beds were comfortable and the service was great. I will definitely choose this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Quality Inn Boardwalk!!”
Reviews.Author: kimserine
Reviews.Content: I came to Ocean City with family and friends and couldn't have been more pleased with the Quality Inn Boardwalk . The customer service was great at check in and very efficient , My room was ready on time and very clean. The maid service was great too!! I can never sleep very well at a hotel but slept great there the beds and pillows were great! The view is awesome no matter what room you stay in . the balcony over looking the ocean is where I spent my mornings having coffee . It had all of the comforts of home and the amenities of a five star hotel. I am going to suggest this to all of my friends !

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: airkraftusa
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly and responsive. The oceanfront room was comfortable and provided a great ocean view. Our favorite spot was poolside, close to Surfin Betty's Grill. The drinks were good and competitively priced. The food, for a poolside grill, was just outstanding. As the title implies, we'll keep coming back. The only real drawback .... be prepared to wait for the elevators. There are only two and it sometimes takes a while to get one without a crowd. But its vacation time, who's in a hurry anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Unethical Walked over July 4th Weekend !”
Reviews.Author: tantam0unt
Reviews.Content: We had a confirmed reservation with this hotel. The hotel OVERBOOKED and informed us the last minutes that we were RELOCATED 51 blocks away from the boardwalk. They claimed that they tried to contact us via phone, but our phone was not in service. This is impossible, and why didn't they also tried to contact me via email? With all these inconveniences, they ONLY offered to give me $50 refund and refused to provide me the full refund. This is the first time I ever heard of a hotel not refunding guest for their accommodation for being relocated. This is what the Front Desk manager told me via email: "Im kind of lost, So you did receive the $50 credit back from us? what other refund are you looking for?" ... "I'm sorry that's how you feel, the hotel cannot refund your full stay. I did hear the girl explain it to you on the phone. We tried contacting you prior to arrival, but the phone number you had booked the hotel with was not in service. Again I apologize for any inconveniences and hope you have a great week." Jason Barrett Front Office Manager Quality Inn Boardwalk Apologizing for the inconveniences doesn't resolve dilemma. He basically told me the answer is NO, now stop contacting me/the hotel for the your refund!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug4882
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, great ammenities, piping hot breakfast and right on the boardwalk; what more could you ask for? We received prompt courteous service from front desk, hassle free maid service and a 60 second checkout. The value of this hotel simply cannot be beat. We have been visiting Ocean City for over 20 years and so far this has been the best value for our dollar. We have stayed at hotels on the boardwalk for the same price, but they have been dives. We have stayed at slightly nicer hotels on the boardwalk but paid twice the price (which is alot of money!!!). There are some other nice places in OC at a good value, but they are well off the beaten path. Quality Inn Boardwalk gives all the perks, is right on the Boardwalk and is afforable. We will return, for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Turned the Frown Upside Down!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dalfin45
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and as soon as we walked up to the check-in counter were told there were no more late arrivals expected... What? After checking we found there had been a miscommunication and they had booked me the week prior and listed me as a no-show! OK, so you can see where this was going! Next thing I know Heather and the staff placed me in one of the Penthouse Sweets! There wasn't the normal he said, she said... None of the normal bickering back and forth about who was right and what should be done. They stepped right up and put my girlfriend and I into the Penthouse and that was that... I commend the guys for that move, as of course, you can't put a price on good word of mouth customer service!!! Now, I have seen a lot of complaints about stains... Old Furnishings, Small Pillows, Smells, etc... The way I look at it, as long as it is a clean stain, clean pillow, clean furnishing, that is what counts! So the pillows are tiny... I cramed three together and had a pillow that Tony Little would have loved to patent! The Suitcase sat over the stain and I never saw it again! As for the smell, I have stayed at many beach hotels and it is hard to isolate the beach smells from the rooms... Over time it just leeches right on in... BUT isn't that the smell you drove down for in the first place! =) Sure the bldg is older, but then again I think most ALL of them are... Is the price a little steep? They ask what the market is willing to pay and not a penny less! So would we... It is all relative... If the rest of the hotels were new and this one was the only older one the prices would likely be lower... That just isn't the case as they are all pretty much the same age... My girlfriend and I would definitely stay there again! Oh, and I couldn't even tell ya if the TV worked as we never were in the room long enough to use it!!! Way to go Staff at the Quality Inn Boardwalk... Reach around and give yourselves a big pat on the back on me! Yay!

Reviews.Title: “Tired property, tiny pillows”
Reviews.Author: fk1959
Reviews.Content: First off, this property has two very different facilities adjacent to one another. There is a fairly modern high rise part of the hotel, and a fairly antiquated lower rise facility with outside hallways and thru the wall AC units. Our room was on the modern side, and was actually OK. It was typical beach boardwalk hotel fair. It gets hard use during the summer, but overall, it was acceptable. One issue though, that you should know about, is that the pillows in this hotel are tiny. Roughly half the size of a regular pillow. When we asked for a standard size pillow, the front desk staff told us that "Choice Hotels won't let us have any other pillows in the rooms." OK, My BS sensor went on high alert. I called Choice Corporate and was told that there was no such policy. The manager on duty insisted, even after I told him about checking with corporate, that this was Choice Hotel policy. Real story I'm sure is that somebody got a deal on a bunch of undersized pillows and if they let anybody have a regular size one, they'd have a flood of folks at the desk asking.

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved”
Reviews.Author: sac2008
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay at this hotel once again this year. I hadn't stayed there since 2007, so I wasn't sure what to expect. It was actually better than before. The indoor pool area has been nicely redone and is no longer stuck in the early 1970's. Most of the rooms have been redone, some more recently than others. I prefer the tower building, which is newer and nicer than the main building. I am not sure when or if the northern view rooms have been redone. Most rooms are efficiencies with either private balconies or patios overlooking the ocean. Our room was nice, spacious, and clean. The hotel has two nice sized outdoor pools and an indoor pool with hot tub. There is also a game room and small exercise room. The pools were cleaned Monday, Wednesday, and Thursday. Paula, the maid, did a good job taking care of our room and giving us new towels. Overall I though that the hotel was quite nice and reasonably priced for Ocean City. I would consider it to be a 2 1/2/ star hotel, as it is neither a dump nor a 5 star resort. Also, while it may not be the newest or nicest, it certainly serves its purpose and there have been a lot of improvements made in recent years. My only suggestions would be to renovate the northern view rooms and it would be nice to have flat screen TVs in the rooms. Thanks again for an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Will not go back.”
Reviews.Author: car076
Reviews.Content: Me my husband and son stayed here end of june and I thought when we walked in the room smelled but not a musty smell also the fridge smelled it needed a good cleaning.Next the breaker box is on the wall near bed and not even covered up they should put something over it,The beds are small and the pillows if that is what you want to call them are really small.The ac unit is rusty and when turned on made alot of noise.The couch could be replaced old and had rips in it.The back door needs to be replaced we had a really hard time opening it every time we went out there.The valances near back door had rips in them also and if you looked up behind them the ceiling needed to be fixed guess they were tring to hide the ceiling.The tv remote was so dirty it looked like it was never cleaned.The bathroom was an updated one so it was nice and clean.The hot tub was nasty it had brown dirt in itfloating around the edges and needed to be cleaned and there were still people in it,it was nasty.The front desk girls young and they didnt go out of there where for you didnt smile and say anything almost felt like you were a borther to them.The view is great but not enough to make us stay here again,we will be staying some where else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Next time I will spend the money for something better!”
Reviews.Author: threeiscomp
Reviews.Content: We arrived right at 3p.m. check in time only to be told we had to wait 10 or 15 more minutes to get to our room. We had a 9 and 5 year old who were cooped up in a car for 7 hours. We get to our room and upon first site it seemed ok. Then I see the sliding glass doors out to the balcony.....YUCK! I don't think they were ever cleaned. You could see mold everywhere. Went out on the balcony and found bottle tabs and cigarette butts and a filthy table. Came in to the room and went to the second place I always check at a hotel, the bathroom. Disgusting is the nicest word I have for it. It was old, and moldy and mildewed. It stunk, the toilet barely flushed, you had to stand there and hold the lever until it completely went down. The beds are small and the pillows are too. After a night of zero sleep because my husband and I couldn't figure out how we could bathe our kids in that nasty tub, my husband went down and told the manager on duty the issues with our room. He was very accomodating and moved us to an oceanfront room with an updated bathroom. That was fine and we were more comfortable except that the cleaning crew only made the beds and left towels. No vacuuming, no cleaning nothing! Also I was under the assumption that it was a non-smoking hotel. As a person who has recently quit smoking, it was very hard to go out and enjoy the balcony without getting overwhelmed by the smell of cigarette smoke! Never, ever again.....I will pay the extra to stay somewhere else.....actually as nasty as Ocean City has become I will just go back to Myrtle Beach for vacation. Oh and don't go to the restaurant for breakfast especially. Family of 4 only ordered the basics and was charged almost 50 bucks and the food was awful, the tables dirty, and the staff not the best!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: majk_p
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a golf trip in early June 2011. The young woman at the front desk wasn't the best person to have as the face of the hotel. She wasn't rude, just short and a bit snappy. Seemed like she didn't want to be there. The hotel itself is OK. Its nothing special. Beds were decent, TV was acceptable, and fridge was nice. But our room had water marks on the ceiling from the above unit, the walls needed repainting, the floor was stained up, and the bathroom had cracked and missing tile. The room felt a bit dingy. On the bright side, the view from the balcony was nice and the walk to the beach took all of 20 seconds, since you're right on the beach. The hotel restaurant wasn't the best, but the boardwalk is right there so its a short walk to whatever you want. Parking is tight at the hotel, but there is additional parking across the street which seemed adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike58318
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week here also stayed here a week several years ago with teens.Great location away from the noise but within walking distance of everything including the bus stop.Two decent pools which were not properly cleaned daily (trash lying about etc)Surfin Bettys beach bar is between the pools and has decent dogs and burgers resonably priced as well as the usual overpriced drinks (but it is on the boardwalk ! ) The place is kind of old but everything in oc below 30 th st. is old.Anyone expecting 5 star accomodations probably won;t like oc anyway.We enjoyed our stay and have no complaints .You wont find better or more private ocean front balconies anywhere in oc especially from the 3rd floor and up

Reviews.Title: “Great Find For Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Gabshu2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we wanted for our get-away. Actually it was more! The room we had was very spacious and clean. And the view from the ocean front balcony couldn't have been better. What was nice about the balconies were that they were private. Most hotels on the boardwalk we saw had balconies that were open and you could see your neighbors every move, but Quality Inn has walls which helps create a buffering for sound and you can have your morning tea in peace. We had booked an efficacy and everything we needed was provided from plates to utensils to dishwasher soap. It really helped in saving money on food. Our Favorite part of the hotel was the fact that it was just far enough from the "action" of the boardwalk. The nights were peaceful and restaurants were within walking distance (my vote Brothers brick house pizza). And if they weren't the bus stop is one block away on 16th. The beach assess is directly out back, so the only walk you have is down to the water. The Staff we met were great and responded to requests promptly. The crowd that we saw while there was a mix of family and older couples staying at the hotel. For the money, we think this is a winner. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Exceeded!”
Reviews.Author: beachplease21842
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Quality Inn 17th street and it as great. All the people we interactated with that worked there were very helpful and guided us to some great places to eat and explore. Rooms were very clean and recently remodeled! Overall great stay and will be booking our next visits here with them for sure. Kuddos again to the staff for being great from the GM to the maintenance man on making us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean view. Clean, spacious room.”
Reviews.Author: susan9352
Reviews.Content: I could have vacationed just on the balcony alone; the ocean view was spectacular. I liked that the balcony had partitions between the rooms which made it very private. The room was spacious and we enjoyed the separate "living"area. This will definitely be our vacation spot for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “You'll need to lower your expections... a LOT"”
Reviews.Author: FlyGuy47
Reviews.Content: Despite the decent reviews and my not-so-high expectations, this place still struck me as a dump. I'd reserved what they apparently call a "standard" room for $81 AAA rate. This turned out to be barely bigger than a walk-in closet with a stand-up stall shower in a tiny bathroom, a noisy rusted-out A/C unit, and a small window that looked out onto a roof. When I asked about other options, the lady at the front desk was about to present me with something when a young guy (apparently her supervisor) interrupted and told me "any other room would cost a whole lot more." Clearly, they weren't full on this Sunday night and could've presented an alternative option, but weren't interested. On top of that, one pool (the nicest one) is padlocked tight. and the vending machine in the hallway was inoperable. Room kinda smelled, too. There are other hotels that don't cost much more and MUST be better. Skip this place.

Reviews.Title: “The cleaniest Hotel I've stayed at in years!”
Reviews.Author: hoovahhh
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Ocean City with my two small children for spring break, this was our best family vaction. I was very impressed with how clean the hotel was. Usually you find dirt in the corners of the bathroom or residue left in the bath tub, but not in this hotel. The kitchen area was also very clean. The bedding was clean and comfy. I never heard any noises from the other rooms while we were in our room, if you were standing in the hallway you could hear noise. We stayed in an ocean front view and the view was amazing, we got to enjoy a beautiful sun rise and a full moon at night. The beach is right there, so there was no long hike through an alley to the beach. They have a foot wash and outside shower to rinse off before you go back into the hotel. Checking in was a breeze as well as checking out. The staff was very friendly. The outside pools were closed but looked great for families with small children. There is an indoor pool and hot tub we didn't use them because it was deeper and my kids don't know how to swim yet. I do plan on returning back to this hotel and can't wait, so we can use the out door pools and enjoy all that Ocean City has to offer during the summer season.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay with great location”
Reviews.Author: tmt4th
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Ocean City for Easter Weekend with my daughter, son and one of their friends. Upon arrival, staff was very eager to make sure we had enough pillows and blankets for our stay. Room was clean and had been updated since my last visit two years ago. We had a wonderful weekend and look forward to staying again in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “great location,very clean,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: luke127
Reviews.Content: perfect location,very clean,friendly staff,in the middle of everything

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: trainman048
Reviews.Content: Wanted to take my wife somewhere special for Easter weekend to unwind..Quality Inn was perfect. Staff happy friendly, rooms clean and ocean breezes just what was needed.Plenty of free parking, coffee always hot and would recommend to all.. Plan on coming back soon

Reviews.Title: “*** WARNING!!!! *** **** DO NOT STAY AT THIS DUMP!!! ****”
Reviews.Author: natalie211
Reviews.Content: Upon checking into this crap hole we were over come with a putrid funk that took over the first floor, I can only describe the smell as a mix between steaming hot garbage and rotting flesh. It was enough to make me dry heave. Once we entered our room, we were thrust into what must have been a time warp. The room was decorated in a disgusting collage of 1970's and early 1980's fashions. One of the beds was completely sunken in, so much so it was comical. The final straw broke 10 minutes after first entering the room. My young daughter went to use the bathroom only to immediately return horrified, after inspection I too was horrified at the findings in the said bathrm. There was a blood filled toilet!!! I flushed and ran out, told my husband and kids to grab their bags that we were NOT staying another second in that dump. I went straight to the front desk were I explained that we would not be staying due to the absolute filthy and vile conditions. ***** I YOU VALUE THE HEALTH AND WELL BEING OF YOUR FAMILY, DO NOT STAY AT THIS DUMP!!! *****

Reviews.Title: “large room”
Reviews.Author: nornette1977
Reviews.Content: good price, pool open till 12:00 a.m., and great ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable with a great view”
Reviews.Author: Bartendo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here about 8 times and will be at this hotel again in a week. 6-8 of us go every April for a golf trip. We have never experienced a problem during any of the trips. The staff treats us well, the pool is great, the rooms are clean and have wonderful views of the ocean, there is always coffee in the lobby, maintenance crews are always busy, maids do a fine job, parking is better than most OC hotels and the rooms are quiet. Is it the Hilton? No. (I have stayed there also) But, do not hesitate about bringing your family or spouse here. April in OC is rather laid back. 3/4 of the businesses are closed until May. But here are a couple of tips: a) Take the taxi cab services. They are quick and very reasonable. b) Eat at Coins (28th street plaza), Nicks Ribs and Seacrets.They are open all year. c) Walk the boardwalk. Off season is like having it to yourself. d) Explore Assateague Island National Park just outside of OC. e) Golfers: try playing at Lighthouse Sound, Rum Pointe, Eagles Landing and Glen Riddle (2 courses).

Reviews.Title: “Coming back!”
Reviews.Author: ADKphotobug
Reviews.Content: Clean, updated room with very comfortable beds and pillows! An indoor pool that you could actually tread water in and a hot tub that was deep and big enough for a few friends. No continental breakfast provided but the restaurant was just fine and not that expensive. Very friendly staff and since we were choice hotel members and arrived very late, they suggested a 2pm check out which we took advantage of! It was the off season so this may have made a difference. The boardwalk was right outside and the beach just beyond that. Set off the road a bit so there is no traffic or people noise. We used our points for a free night. Stayed on the 7th floor and the view was spectacular as you can imagine. This is not the Hilton nor does it pretend to be; just Quality Inn at it's best and a lot less expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: jcraig10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the off season so were able to get a great oceanfront room for a great price! The room was very big and comfy...except for the pillows - they were small and square, I didn't like them at all! No ice machine on the floors, you have to go down to the main level. And I wouldn't use the hottub for all of you who stay in the summer time...we saw what that thing looks like in the winter and it is NOT PRETTY! they don't even cover it! Also, the main parking lot is pretty tight, but they do have another one across the street. Other than that, no complaints, our stay was great and the maids and the front desk workers were very friendly. If your choice is between Quality Inn Boardwalk between 16th & 17th st and Quality Inn on 31st St curve, definitely choose this one on 16th!!! it is much cleaner and nicer! and the stafff is much more helpful!!! GREAT LOCATION RIGHT ON THE BOARDWALK!

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere esle to stay”
Reviews.Author: BawsMom
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was very rude. I asked for a different room as my was located with an outside entrance, they had no interest in helping us. The door and casing had about 2" gap letting wind low in. Overall room was not clean. Blue toliet with seat had mulitple gouges in it. I sent photos and letter to corporate headquarters, but never recieved a response. I will never stay at any Choice hotel after this.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but just OK”
Reviews.Author: shoffy66
Reviews.Content: Stay there with my wife for our anniversary weekend. Front desk was nice and let us check in 2 hours early. Room was average at best. Found out the first night that the bed was lousy, neither of us had a good night's sleep either night. The sliding door to the patio was off it's hinge and allowed the cold wind into the room. The room smelled bad of mildew/mold & there was a big bug smashed on the wall. The front desk did someone up within 30 mins to fix the door and try to get rid of the smell. Nothing was done about the bug. The location was perfect, right on the boardwalk, and you cant beat the price of $63 a night (thanks ocisfree.com), but our room left alot to be desired. The gameroom, if that is what you want to call it, consisted of 4 games and one was broke. The work out room was below average. My wife's favorite work out machine was basically out of use due to rust causing no movement. The jacuzzi was nice but the indoor pool was missing about a foot of water. Saw they were filling it Saturday evening.

Reviews.Title: “I love it here. Cheapest place on the...”
Reviews.Author: nelsonlm
Reviews.Content: I love it here. Cheapest place on the boardwalk that is clean and has efficiencies. Will always stay here!

Reviews.Title: “ASK FOR A PREMIER ROOM ONLY”
Reviews.Author: oceangirl11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 3 night stay at the Quality Inn. When we first got to our room I could not believe it. It was disgusting. The furniture was gross, the bathroom was disgusting, and the carpet looked like it was never cleaned, I could not believe it. My brother had just got back from staying here and said how great it was. I went down to the front desk and told them how unhappy we were. I also told them about my brother. They said he must of stayed in a PREMIER ROOM. Melissa could not of been any nicer. She let us have a PREMIER ROOM for no extra charge (would of cost us an extra 20 per night). The room was GREAT. It had new furniture, king size bed, large refrigerator, dishwasher, stove, and cabinets with dishes. What a difference! I was also told at checkout that they are going to redo the other section of the hotel this winter. Thank you so much Melissa and the rest of the front desk for making our stay GREAT. We will be back next year!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much - booking another trip before we even get home!”
Reviews.Author: TriStateTravelers
Reviews.Content: I planned a "golf vacation" as a surprise for my husband's 50th birthday. The girls at the Tee1Off (Harrison Group) golf office were great. They helped me pick three courses, set up our tee times, made arrangements for our room, etc., etc., etc. After I booked, as our trip was getting closer, I went on TripAdvisor and began to become somewhat concerned due to some of the reviews. Well, we weren't disappointed at all! The room - although very worn - was clean and comfortable. The staff is very accomodating and friendly and the location of this hotel is amazing! It is about 200' to the beach.. overlooking the ocean. It's far enough up the boardwalk to be a little quieter.. but not too far to go for a walk, dinner or a cocktail. I have already begun our plans to go back in the Spring! It's worth the 10 hour drive for us ... very relaxing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean View”
Reviews.Author: para12mike
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Labor Day weekend. We were on the 6th floor with a great Ocean View. We have absolutely no complaints. Check in was smooth, staff was friendly and courteous. We did not eat in the restaurant or use any of the 3 pools. The room was clean and had all the basic necessities. The king size bed was comfortable. We will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome again”
Reviews.Author: mmazz22
Reviews.Content: Just got back from another stay with the Quality Inn boardwalk. Loved the room. We had an extra special room as we were on one of the end rooms. The beauty of the end rooms in floors seven and up is that you have two windows in your room. The windows offer a view of the boardwalk and the bay. Loved it. The hotel was busy but things ran smooth. Will defiantly stay here again. Thanks for a great stay! but please please please get wireless internet in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: saraschott
Reviews.Content: I used to come to Ocean City when I was younger with my family and stayed at the same hotel every year. When my brother invited my husband and I to vacation with their family it was a struggle finding a hotel, until I came upon the Quality Inn on the Boardwalk. Booking online was very easy and the customer service was wonderful when I called with questions. I was surprised how beautiful the hotel was when I went to check in. It is not done justice by the pictures online. The lobby is beautiful, amenities were beyond expectations with a kitchenette, coffee maker, fridge and dishwasher! The room was welcoming and romantic for a young couple like us (or couple that is young at heart), yet practical and spacious for a family. The staff at the hotel was beyond compare, polite and kind, and ready to answer any question or address any concern. I would stay here anytime I plan on visiting Ocean City, the best on the boardwalk!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VACATION”
Reviews.Author: alhalfenger
Reviews.Content: If you want an easy way to stay in Ocean City this is it .One of our friends says isn't it crowded . We told them we park the car and walk or take the tram up and down the boardwalk. We walk to minny golf. The hotel has great pools (3 of them) .If you want to relax they have a snackbar at the pool. My wife and like to get up early and sit on the balcony have our coffee,watch the waves and the people riding the bikes on the boardwalk. The Hotel is great and Ocean City is great . We look forward to going there every Year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: DelawareLadyBug
Reviews.Content: It was a very wonderful experience- I was alone for my vacation the first time in 49 years and just sitting by the beautiful pool and listening to the ocean, sea gulls, etc. gave me a feeling of peace and reflection.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Quality Inn Boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: RavensFan1234
Reviews.Content: The Quality Inn Boardwalk in Ocean City is a great hotel for many reasons. The room was very large in comparison to typical hotel rooms. The beds were comfortable (especially the pillows). The kitchen had everything we needed to cook a meal, including a full size fridge. The balcony was also spacious. We didn't have an ocean front room, but could still see the ocean from the balcony. The hotel also has a nice gym with a couple of treadmills, some strength training equipment, and some other cardio equipment. The best part about the gym was the flat screen TV! If you like to enjoy the occasional cocktail while on vacation, there is a bar right on the boardwalk in front of the hotel. We also ate at the restaurant for breakfast - the food and service was great! Overall, it was a fantastic stay at the Quality Inn Boardwalk and we will definitely stay here during our next visit to Ocean City!

Reviews.Title: “Not High End, but Worth It for What It Is.”
Reviews.Author: BenJF3
Reviews.Content: Keeping in mind this is not a high end "luxury" hotel, I have to say it is worth it. Upon check in, we were informed of a power outage and had to hoof it 9 floors. However, the hotel is not the power company so I don't fault them. The power issue was resolved within an hour and we prefer the 9th floor room because of the stunning view! The other big plus for this hotel is the location right on the Boardwalk. The cost wasn't a factor as we cashed in our Choice Reward Points, but the room would have cost about $330 if we paid for it. Other amenities include 2 outdoor pools, 1 indoor pool, outdoor hot tub and bar. The staff was very accommodating when we were in need of anything as well. The rooms themselves are very dated, but we really didn't spend much time in them. We wanted close proximity to the Boardwalk with Ocean Front view and this location delivered. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good access to boardwalk, that's about it”
Reviews.Author: ejsantiago
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Quality Inn Boardwalk for one night after the Hilton Oceanfront couldn't accommodate an extra evening. We couldn't wait to leave. We would not bring our daughters back here again. At this property, you are only paying for the location in the center of the boardwalk. It is actually motel style as every room has an outside entrance only. The "suite" was small, very old, and in dire need of maintenance. The only way to separate the (doubles, not even queens) beds from the fold out couch was a very dirty curtain. When you opened the fold out, you couldnt get past the big tv hutch to get to the patio. The patio doors didnt close well, and let in plenty of noise. Every time the people upstairs opened their balcony door, it sounded like thunder. The door to the room was thin and didn't block the noise from the people outside. When we arrived, there were bugs all over the kitchen area and the tiny kitchen table still had food crusted on it . The staff cleaned it when informed, so the service is responsive at least. The bathroom appeared to be reasonably clean. This is probably a great place for young partyers who want a place in the middle of the boardwalk, but not for families who are accustomed to Hyatts and Hiltons.

Reviews.Title: “Beach, Pools, Hot Tub, Fantastic View, Front Row Seats to the "Party"”
Reviews.Author: gprn
Reviews.Content: This place has everything! We could go to the beach, and if the water was cold or rough, run back and jump in the pool or hot tub! Our balcony looked out on the parade along the boardwalk morning, afternoon and evening. We felt like we were at a big party the whole time. The room was huge! Staff was pleasant and accommodating. Concierge arranged golf lessons which turned out to be fabulous. We had a GREAT time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but be careful.”
Reviews.Author: goldenmaggie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with three other families. I got a two bed/eff. pool level. Upon entering my room, I was greatly disappointed with the condition and cleanliness. I called my friend to come to my room so that she can compare it's condition with hers. She was horrified and thought I had spent much less than she had ; but I was spending the same (with tax my room was just over $300 a night). I called the front desk and they immediately gave me a key to another room a few doors down. The new room had one bed but was in better condition: since there was only two of us I took it. I would never spend such a great amount to stay on Ocean City again unless the place was newer. Four familes each spending $1500 for five nights in a hotel like this is crazy expensive--it's worh half that.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: LanaTurner50
Reviews.Content: We really liked the location of the Quality Inn. The room was OK, not outstanding but my concern this year was bed bugs and they didn't have any. We were booked at the Tidelands and changed it due to the reviews of the Tidelands being so dirty. We will stay here again. We liked that they had two outdoor pools as well as an indoor pool and a hot tub. The only negative was that housekeeping missed us one day but they did send the evening housekeeper to our room at 6:30.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, poor service hotel”
Reviews.Author: nofrills1234
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid, I thought the hotel would be decent. No, the sofa was dirty and the walls had water and rust stains all over. The balcony doors were so noisy that I thought it was thunder when my neighbors opened and closed the balcony door. I paid extra for the ocean view, but I got a real good view of the bar and pool. The front desk people were rude and nasty. I tried to check in early and they called to say my room was ready right at 3pm. I would not stay here again, especially cause I paid over $300 for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Suspect at its best”
Reviews.Author: WherearetheVacations
Reviews.Content: O.k. here is the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth. I originially was not suppose to come here. I was suppose to be in Miami, but there was a tropical storm approaching July 23rd and rain and thunderstorm was in the forecast, so we had to take the kids somewhere. HILTON was booked so I had to take someone's advice. O.k. first about the hotel. Someone swore up and down that it this hotel was good, even after reading the reviews I was hesitate, but the person told me not to believe the reviews on tripadvisor - Suggestion BELIEVE THE REVIEWS ON TRIPADVISOR. Oh boy, where do I begin. Quality Inn Boardwalk PROS: the view from balcony. I had a king size room with pull out. Oceanfront view. That was nice. CONS: The receptionist swore up and down that my room (room 509) was in the premium renovated area. - TILL THIS DAY I STILL DON'T BELIEVE IT!.
