I guess everyone have their own defiintion of renovated and premium. Just look at the pictures. I am not lying!!!! Please believe the reviews that are rated from average to poor. They are not lying!!!! My room was outdated and old. Brown carpet, I mean come on really. The room was right by the elevator, if you do not want to be waken up by people talking in the hallway and chatting, do not take this room. Really do not pick this hotel. Everything just seemed old and outdated and we were in the renovated section! So I cannot imagine how the nonrenovated section looks! DO NOT EAT AT THE HOTEL: The all you can eat breakfast buffet, disguisting looking. Too pricey like 8.95 for adults and even children under four still had to pay. It was dark inside the restaurant, which I definitely do not do. I must see my food and see cleanliness. OCEAN CITY in general is a waste of time. The beach is dirty and the water stinks and is the color brown. I am not lying!!!!. So when you read these reviews regarding how clean the hotel was and how beautiful OCEAN CITY is and how they would come here again and again. I CANNOT SEE IT! and I was only there for a weekend. I am sure, you can do karoake, carnival, mini golf, racecar track in your own area for half the cost. What is the atrraction to OC? I am still wondering!!!!. The dirty beach? I have spoken to many people who have stayed a week! Why? I have spoken to people who have come here year after year - Why? I'm sorry to say this. The only type of people I see , are low income, people who could never afford to go to the carribbean and see what clean water looks like or people who just don't know any better, or people seeing something I CANNOT SEE! I would NEVER recommend coming to OC! NEVER NEVER NEVER! Here is a tip: There is a trolley or bus, whatever it is called that goes up and down the boardwalk. It costs $3.00 one way. Everyone pays, even if you have a small child. SKIP. Go two blocks and take the city bus for $2.00 all day ride! AND THE BUSES RUN FREQUENTLY. The most we waited at a stop was ten minutes. Also in the evening, do be careful crossing the street. My husband almost got hit by a Papa Johns delivery man. His fault entirely, we had the right of way to cross, he was not looking. Thank GOD he didn't pull off fast, or we would be on the 6 o'clock news. RESTARUANTS are all the same quality - TRUST Me when I say this!!!! Embers, Hall's, CASTLE IN THE SAND, English's = Poor lighting and overpriced food. You can go to Golden Corral and have better quality of food, better pricing and lighting

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the beach!”
Reviews.Author: MerlethePearl
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy our visits to the Quality Inn Boardwalk. We love the spectacular view of the ocean and boardwalk from the balcony. You park your car and you never have to move. It is convenient to restaurants, perfect spot on the boardwalk, close enough to walk to shops, etc., but not a noisy and rowdy area. There are two pools to play in and an outdoor shower to rinse off the sand. The beds are comfortable and weve always had a clean room and good maid service. The staff is a fun and friendly group and is ready to do anything to make you happy. The concierge was very helpful with restaurant choices and lining up golf outings. The kitchen is a perfect size with full size fridge and dishwasher. The balcony has table and chairs to enjoy breakfast, lunch and happy hour. Happy hour also offered downstairs at Ocean View with yummy half price steamed spiced shrimp. There is always fresh fruit at the front desk and complimentary coffee available all day. Its great to catch the sunrise in the comfort of your PJs from the oceanfront balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Charged too much money for the quality.”
Reviews.Author: Lookin2Relax2010
Reviews.Content: My room cost came to $300.00 after taxes and fees. The first room I was assigned smelled like an ashtray. Needless to say, someone with COPD and non-smokers could NOT stay here! We called the front desk and they were able to re-assign us to another room which was non-smoking. The room was clean, however, the ceiling leaked on one of us all night, the tile in the bathroom was nasty, the ceiling "heat" lamp was without a bulb and all rusted out, the bathroom vent was full of dust, the room didn't have the mini-kitchen as the originally assigned room however we were still charged the same amount. The staff did credit my credit card 10% due to the ceiling leaking. There was just no way that I felt I they should be charging the rates they are charging for such outdated rooms. I did take pics because I couldn't believe a Quality Inn would look like this honestly.

Reviews.Title: “Never Have I been treated with such disrespect....”
Reviews.Author: SBWFairfield_ME
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend in April. It was off season. I was quoted and emailed a room priced and then charged more when I got there. The managers were rude and disrespectful. I have been arguing with corporate headquarters since April about getting a refund and they keep passing the buck. I travel all over the United States quite often and am a travel agent....let me say I will never offer up this hotel again. Besides being treated rudely, the air conditioning didn't work....I was told to "leave my deck door open and get the breeze" Just what I wanted to do with bars on both sides of me. Everything was dated and very old. Plumbing didn't work well in my friends room beside me and it took them a whole day to fix it. There are plenty of nice places to stay on this strip in Ocean City.....I would highly suggest staying somewhere else. Oh ya and it doesn't matter if you get quoted anything in writing....the customer is NEVER right in this place. They need some lessons in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised with all the amenities and ocean front view!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy123456
Reviews.Content: Compared to prices of other Boardwalk hotels, I was expecting an average hotel room with two beds and side view of the ocean. I was VERY pleasantly surprised to have a full kitchen and living room, with curtains to separate the living/bedroom area. Plus, we had full, front ocean view over the boardwalk. Not only was our room nice and clean, the three pool areas were very clean. I saw staff members cleaning throughout the day. I am very picky about hotels, especially cleaniness. This place was great! And the vending machine was only $1.00 for a bottle of soda! The only problem we had was the operation of our balcony sliding-glass door.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for OC Air Show, nice staff but no WIFI in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: treki999
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for the air show. You can watch it from your balcony if your room is oceanfront and on the 2nd floor or higher. The view from the two pool areas was good except when the planes dipped low across the ocean. The beach area directly in front of the hotel was secured for the event VIP section, but the open beach area was not far. The staff (front desk and pool staff) was gracious and made efforts to remember that I was guest so I did not have to keep showing my room key to access the pool areas. I will repeat what a previous review said in May. The hotel is a little old and could use a face lift. NOTE: If your room is in the tower with the elevators, your furniture appears to newer i.e. late 80s/early 90s. The bathrooms i.e. toilet seat was worn , faucet would not completely shut off, front door was warped on one room, balcony latch clicks to the lock position if you close the sliding glass door quickly. If the bathroom was not in the 70s blue color, a guest may not have noticed the wear and tear. There was a little rust on the bathroom ceiling (see pictures). But, on a positive note, the bathroom has screened sliding window to air out. Water pressure is very good. Shower has massage head with four settings. Beds were clean and comfortable and four fluffy pillows for each bed. The sofa could use new seat cushions. Balconies are large with concrete dividers, nice and private with two chairs and half moon table. There is a full kitchen (full refrigerator, single sink, dishwasher (new), microwave, coffee maker, cook top, pots, pans, utensils, etc.) The corner has a television (28") with local channels, Discovery, TLC, History and others. The hotels (Ocean Place) restaurant is not recommended for breakfast. They do not serve a bad breakfast but it is not Dough Roller or Layton breakfast for the same price. If you are OC regular, you understand. Wireless: Despite the hotel book stating you have WIFI in the rooms and placing a card in your rooms to call tech support, contact the front desk. When I called the front desk, they said "internet access is only available in the lobby.” Just in case the employee was mistaken, I called the next shift and they told me the same thing. I was made a true believer when I had passed through lobby on my way to dinner and saw a Thunderbird pilot (6"2" and FINE) sitting in a cramped position on the low lobby sofas with this laptop. The final question "Would you stay here again?" Answer is "Yes" It is not the Hilton but it is good hotel in a great location with wonderful staff and there is not any mold or bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Hot tub use”
Reviews.Author: survivorlookinforfun
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at another local Quality Inn @ 54th street. Because this facility had longer amenity hours, we were advised to use this boardwalk location for its amenities. We enjoyed ourselves. The front staff was excellent and very friendly. The only problem was the hot tub. It had such an excess of chlorine, that it turned my brown skin white. It destroyed my swimsuit. Once I returned back to the hotel, and unpacked my suit, I saw how the chlorine had begun eating away at the material. The suit had white residue and the skirt of the suit was thin. So, use the pool area with caution. Do not use your new swim suit at this pool!

Reviews.Title: “well worth on a budget”
Reviews.Author: sassylady36
Reviews.Content: took my mother to oc for spring fest and mothers day,to my surprise both rooms was pleasantly nice since it was on the older side.mother enjoyed having all the likes of being home and sitting on the balcony over looking ocean.this was her first trip out any place in about 30yrs,and she had a very nice time,my daughter enjoyed the inside pool and sauna as well, clean and maintained very well.clean rooms,hotel very clean,and staff was always polite.enjoyed our vacation all the way around!

Reviews.Title: “Very poor hotel - needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: lmsullivan1
Reviews.Content: To many things wrong with the room to list them here, the few items they could fix (bathtub plug, lights that were out, toilet seat ready to fall off) were never fixed during our 3 night stay after 2 requests. I was charged a higher rate upon checkin, had the email showing agreed to rate and they put a refund on my Amex. High Speed Internet service was horrible, up and down so basically not working even with the ethernet connection/bridge you sign out from the desk. Room was dirty, bare wood showing behind headboard, raw carpet edges showing. Front door lock was unsafe, loose parts, extremely difficult to open and close, 2 of the 3 locks not working. The real "plus" is the view of the ocean and/or bay from being up on a high floor. They definately need to shut down sections of this hotel, renovate and then reopen at the decent/acceptable quality you usually get from a Choice Hotels property. I was very embarrassed to have my family with me at this hotel. I rarely write a bad review.........would rather do "no review" but could not do that with this stay. I'm sure they must have some nice rooms out of the 180 rooms or they couldn't get customers...........but room 615 should be out of service.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in OC!!”
Reviews.Author: smb880
Reviews.Content: very nice place to stay. all of the staff is friendly and helpful!! a great location and atmosphere, I always have a good time at the quality inn. the penthouse is pretty sweet, and everything is nicely taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View and Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sam Y
Reviews.Content: I wanted to do a budget spring break trip in March, so I decided to drive to Ocean City. I opted for an Oceanfront room and it was definitely worth the extra $10. The room had an extra living room area and had a patio with table and chairs that had a nice ocean view. I was pleasantly surprised to find that the room had a stove, microwave, refrigerator and sink. This was helpful because hardly any restaurants were open in the area during the off season. The high speed internet was so-so it required an adapter from the front desk that plugged into a power outlet. Even after using the adapter I didn't have a very good connection.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, room was perfect”
Reviews.Author: bkc71
Reviews.Content: Our room was ground floor but very private. We could see the ocean and sit out on our patio and enjoy while the kids went to bed. The curtain seperating the living room was handy when the kids went to bed early. We could not have been happier with the location. Hotel could benefit from renovations but the room was clean. The pool side bar quieted down at night and did not cause us problems but was nice during the day for a drink. Would not recommend restaurant. No internet connection in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: PennsylvaniaNana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely the best that I have ever stayed in. It was exceptionally clean. The front desk and staff were very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. The room was huge, very clean and beautifully decorated. It had an awesome deck with ocean view. The indoor pool was heated to the perfect temperature as was the spa. There was fresh coffee in the lobby at all times. The rates during the winter are really good. I can't wait to return to this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in the Off Season”
Reviews.Author: smoman
Reviews.Content: Stay here a few times a year in the off season during the week. Oceanfront room, great and courteous people at the hotel, clean room, fast elevators, quick service,no traffic, plenty of restaurants open near the hotel, bar and restaurant specials locally in the off season. The only concern during the off season is maintenance of the hotel. Recommend checking to see what maintenance is taking place when you're visiting.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: snoopy21
Reviews.Content: rooms were clean stayed on the 4th floor oceanfront. room was a little outdated but nice with full sized refrig stove microwave and coffee pot. nice sized bathroom great view indoor pool and hot tub very nice would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: DCorley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Quality for a few years in a row July 4th week Each year we have seem some improvments as they do upgrades We always stay in the tower building and it is the most improved This year there was a problem with the check out and after I placed a few calls and talked to the right person it was taken care of We will go back again and again I am sure

Reviews.Title: “surprised”
Reviews.Author: mmazz22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times. The last time was about five years ago. The place then was ghetto. I swore I would never stay there again. Well anyways I decided to give it a go this year, the rate was a fair one. I stayed there from Tuesday 9/1-9/6. I found this place had the best rates for where I like to stay. (prefer to stay on 12-17 th st) I had specified that I wanted an end room in the premium section. Upon check in i was told I would be in room 210. I said that wont work as it is right above the outdoor bar and the view sucks. I told them that when I booked the room I had asked for an end with the window in the room. They moved me to 610 no window but location was great. I found the room to be nice compared to my last visit. I found the water pressure to be awesome.(i am really picky about shower water pressure.) The full size refrig was very nice. Table on balcony was also nice as I have stayed in many other hotels in OC that dont believe in balcony tables ,so this was much appreciated. Room was cleaned daily to my satisfaction. I did find the hotel a bit dirty at times, like a chicken wing bone on the stairs for two days, the stairwells are completly nasty, and the lack of wireless internet in the rooms this day and age is not acceptable. Also upon entering the room the room stunk something fierce,stunk of musty/mildew. Went to front desk,she sent a housekeeper up very quickly who sprinkled something on the carpet and the room smelled fine from there on out. At times I found it hard to believe that quality inn upon thier yearly inspections passes this place. But again end of season Im sure the property took a beating over the long season. Air con worked great too.Elevators were speedy, and outdoor bar was great. Had two nights of fun there and both bar tenders Andy and Jason were awesome. Also to note,I had thought about staying an extra night and the place was full but they did try to accomadate me by offering me one of the first floor motel rooms. So would I return. Sure I would if my friend goes with doesn t get marriot points next year and if the rate was the same as it was this year. For the money I found much value in this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Dirty and Dirty!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nuke360
Reviews.Content: We spent $300.00 per night to stay in their so called Penthouse. Gross!! The elevator only went to the 9th floor and you had to walk up two flights of stairs to even reach it. We were not offered any assistance or help by the front desk at all! The elevator and the corrider were not air-conditioned at all. It gets worse...the door was broken and missing a screw and we had trouble even entering using the cardkey. The carpet was filthy and did not even go to the edges of the wall. Its the first time I felt the need to wear my shoes inside a hotel room. Their was mold on the ceiling and and paint peeling off everywhere. We found someones dirty hairbrush behind the door and a clump of human hair on one of the towels that were supposed to have been laundered. The shower head and DVD were both broken and we also found a screw on the floor that my baby daughter could have picked up and swalllowed! What a fright! Their was old food splashed all over the drapes in the kitchen that appeared not to be cleaned off at all. The place needs renovated from top to bottom. We asked the front desk to fix the front door and they ignored all of our requests. When we complained about how filthy the room was the managers response was and I quote "well you have to remember we did not leave the room like that!" What a stupid comment to make coming from a manager! We demanded some of our money be refunded and did get at least $200.00 back but that wasn't enough in my opinion. They also false advertise plasma tv's in each room! What a flat out lie this was. They were very old projection tv's and the screen was so bad you could hardly even watch it. The only redeeming quality whatsoever about the penthouse was the view.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: clipper089
Reviews.Content: We just got home from OC two days ago. I have to say we really enjoyed our stay at the Quality Inn Boardwalk. The staff was great, pools were nice and kept very clean. The gym was minimal but we did a lot of walking so it didn't really matter to us. Our room was also clean, can use some remodeling but other than that we were very happy there and would certainly recommend this Hotel. Good location too.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: meoluoi
Reviews.Content: PROS: - The Concierge lady (August 28th, morning shift) was charm and helpful. A+ to her - 2 big swimming pools and 1 hot spa - Room is clean and its view is awesome (ocean front) - Kitchen with refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, and housewares. - FREE parking - Best location in the heart of Ocean City: on the Boardwalk CONS: - No internet wireless in room. I had go to the lobby to get online. Well! it's FREE! - No flat screen TV. - Minor issue: electrical breaker box which is located next to the bed and it's not safe for children. It needs to be LockOut/TagOut. Conclusion: I didn't regret. My $$ was well spend. :) I definitely will come back on next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Improvements Noted”
Reviews.Author: Dad-With-Two-Kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality in back in 2007 and thought it was an adequate hotel with a great location and less expensive than nearby alternatives. We waited until it was too late to book a reservation in 2008, but returned recently fter a two year absence. The improvements were noticeable. The place seems to have less wear and tear, and a cleaner look, the service is even friendlier - the addition of a concierge is a nice touch - and there has been some remodeling. For example, there are brand new restrooms by the indoor pool. The big advantage of this hotel is its location at 16th street on the boardwalk. Further up, there are very few shops and places to eat. Further down and it gets noisey. Also, to the west of the the boardwalk near 16th street are lots of things within short walking distance: a CVS pharmacy, a catholic church, miniature golf, Layton's for donuts, etc. The hotel has two outdoor pools in addition to the indoor one. One of the outdoor pools used to be saltwater and attracted birds, but both now are chlorine. There is a decent exercise room and small arcade. The main restaurant now emphasizes ribs and barbeque and was respectable. There is also a bar and grill by the outdoor pools. We stayed in a nice-sized family suite with a pull-out couch for the kids which can be curtained off from the parents' bed. The kitchen has a full-size refigerator, stove, microwave oven, dishwasher, and toaster. Our room was in the "tower" section on the southside which seems better than the northside - the hotel was apparently once two hotels that were eventually joined together. You can find fancier places to stay on either side of the Quality Inn: a new Courtyard by Marriott and a very upscale Holiday Inn but will have to pay extra bucks for either. To us, the Quality Inn will do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jjny06
Reviews.Content: My husband, 6 y/o son and I stayed here for the first time. After reading some of the reviews, I was very apprehensive about keeping my reservation. Check in was very easy and pleasant. We had a 4th floor North view room. The room was great. Very spacious and clean. All the kitchen ammenities you would want, even a small dishwasher! The only complaint I have is about the bathroom. It is probably the original bathroom and has had no updates. The cabinet doors were sort of curled up at the bottom and nailed shut. No drain stop in the tub or sink. The grout for the tile on the floor is wearing away. There was hardly any space to keep all your travel toiletries out at one time. The sink faucet was loose and needed tightened. But I must say, these things would not deter me or my family from staying here again. My son loved it. You can not beat the location. There are 2 pools right on the boardwalk. No matter what time we showed up, we always found a chair. I would recommend this hotel to a friend or family member, but some may not be as forgiving about the bathroom. Everyone is different as to what they would tolerate. I also must mention how glad I was that the elevator on the north side of the hotel was very well lit. I did not feel leary about going on it late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: gumlaces
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be in a great location. It was right on the boardwalk, not far from the amusement park, and close to many restaurants. The rooms however, were not as great as we thought they would be. The room definitely wasn’t new and it looked like it hadn’t been fixed since the 1960’s. We thought that since we booked our room kind of late, and that it was peak season that we just got one of the last rooms available. We decided it was something we could live with, and that we would just spend a lot of time outside. When we decided to watch some tv in the room, we turned it on and had a terrible picture. When we went to check the cords in the back of the tv, a mouse ran out from under a chair and ran to somewhere else in the room. We told the staff what we had seen, and they were very VERY nice about everything. They were very accommodating and moved us to another, nicer, bigger room. Our second room was still old looking, but definitely not as bad as the first mouse room. We had a beautiful view of the ocean, and enjoyed sitting out on our deck everyday (even though the sliding door was squeaky). The maid did an excellent job with our room, and got us new fresh towels everyday, and even did our dishes for us!! We really enjoyed the 3 pools they had. We didn’t use the inside pool though because we wanted to be outside as much as possible and enjoy the sun! The outside pools were very clean and inviting, and we didn’t have any trouble finding lounge chairs next to the pool, like we do in some hotels. The parking was not bad either, it was hard to find a spot in the main lot, but the second lot was right across the street, and easy to get to. We had no problems parking at the hotel. I didn’t like that there wasn’t any Internet availability in the rooms. You had to go down to the lobby to get wireless internet, and even then it was hard because there were always people down there, and there wasn’t much room to sit. One day when I went down there to use the internet, the manager came over to me and gave me a box that allowed me to hook up in my room, which was much more convenient for me. I would say that if it weren’t for the mouse in our first room, and the rooms were updated, we would have had a great visit!! I guess it all depends on what room you get placed in. I'm not sure if I would recommend it to people, because some rooms are better than others, and the rooms are still old and a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice experience, better than average”
Reviews.Author: bustertheboa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a family friend who goes to Ocean City, Maryland almost every summer. The location is EXCELLENT, right in the middle of the Boardwalk. The rooms are decent sized and very comfortable, although not exceptionally roomy or spacious. Having a full sized refrigerator and fully stocked kitchenette was extremely convenient, and money saving as well. I was duly impressed by how quiet and efficient the AC was also, after hearing/reading some other complaints -- which, in my opinion, are completely unfounded. The beds were comfortable, with firm mattresses and fluffly pillows. But I and my family are used to queen beds, and these were only full size beds. While the difference is only 6 inches (60 inches for a queen, 54 inches for a full), it was still a little annoying. The pull out sofa bed would have been torture for an adult to sleep on, but probably would be okay for a small child. Put an air matress on it, though, and you're good to go irrespective of your age and size. The room service was very good. Plenty of clean fresh towels daily, which was critical, as the towels were rather flimsy and small. Our chamber maid did a nice job of cleaning the room and removing trash everyday. We were impressed and pleased with the lack of sand in the hotel room, in spite of it being peak tourist season. The shower drained very slowly, but not enough for us to complain to maintenance. Definite plusses include the indoor pool and hot tub, well equipped exercise room, two outdoor pools, and a very nice grill right next to one of the outdoor pools. All of these amenities were much enjoyed and appreciated. The restaurant in the hotel was also pretty good. The breakfast buffet is worth it, but the dinner menu was lackluster -- not bad, mind you -- just not particularly good. We had a balcony with an oceanfront view. Of course that also meant we had to deal with the Boardwalk noise, as we were only on the second floor. The balcony was small, but very private and comfortable, with a splendid view of the ocean. One con was that the sun always beamed into our room through the balcony window early every morning, since the ocean was east of the hotel, and our room darkening curtains did not close all the way. This was annoying if you wanted to sleep in. Moreover, the balcony doors made a HORRIBLE grating and creaking noise whenever anyone in the adjoining units opened or closed them. At first we thought it was thunder. That is literally how loud it was. Then we figured it was people moving furniture around. It took us a day or two to figure out what was making the racket, but there was nada we could do about it. A couple other beefs: The TV was only 25 inches, and the old-fashioned CRT with a bubble screen. Since we had gotten a "recently renovated PREMUIM" room, I was surprised that this was not updated to a larger flat panel. Also, the bathroom HAD NO FAN. That's right... NO FAN. This is the only hotel I have EVER stayed in where this was the case. Odor and humidity accumulated quickly in the small bathroom. Of course there was a window you could open, but then anyone walking by the room could just look in and see the entire lavatory. Lastly, the high speed internet is a joke. In order to get it in your room, you need an I-Bridge. There is no WiFi or ethernet port in the rooms. Apparently the hotel does not have many of these I-Bridges. I put my name on a list for one. My family was there for 5 nights and 4 days, and I never got one. If you can get one, however, I was told that in-room high speed internet access would be free. There was free WiFi in the lobby, but this was very limited. For the most part, both speed and signal strength were low. It did get the job done, but very very S_L_O_W_L_Y. I was not the only one to comment on this. A couple of other guests also tried utilizing the free WiFi in the lobby, with similar results. Then again, I suppose one cannot expect much if the service is gratis. Still, I would have thought that high speed internet in the guest rooms (without needing an I-Bridge) would be a given, as it is nearly 2010. All that having been said, the overall experience was a positive one. I would give this hotel a rating of good/better than average -- about 3-1/2 stars. Unfortunately, there is no such rating on Trip Advisor. Since the people at the front desk, the chamber maids, and the concierge were all very friendly and helpful, I am being magnanimous and rounding up to a 4-star experience. That is NOT to say the hotel is a 4-star facility -- only that I and my family had an overall positive experience, would probably stay there again, and we would recommend the place to others (with the above caveats).

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: OCtraveler_9
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay there again. Room was a great size (side ocean view), liked the amenities like the dishwasher and kitchen. Very convenient to the beach and boardwalk. Loved the 2 ocean front pools with the bar in the middle. Not too many hotels on the boardwalk have not one but two pools right on the boardwalk. Loved the hot tub and used the indoor pool when it rained and late at night. The kids literally went from the beach to the pool and back again. They were exhausted by the end of the day. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The TV did not work and the toilet was not working properly upon check in but the problem was rectified immediately. The handyman was very nice. The cleaning woman was also very friendly and courteous. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel one night and it was very good. The service there was excellent. You get a lot for your money. The bathrooms can use updating and more room for your "stuff" but we looked beyond that because the room was very clean. We had a terrible experience with the Quality Inn Ocean front and switched to this hotel the same day. The staff here was very helpful and accommodating. The beds were very comfy (in fact I bought the pillows from Housekeeping because I loved them so much). The pull out couch was not that comfortable according to my son, so he just slept on the couch instead of pulling it out. The boardwalk location was perfect as well - not too close to the noisier part of the boardwalk but within walking distance when you are ready for it. Bathrooms in the lobby are very clean and someone was always mopping up the hallway inside where the pool was and someone was always hosing down the area where you wash off your sandy feet.

Reviews.Title: “all around perfect”
Reviews.Author: 4hsglory
Reviews.Content: A perfect get-a-way for my daughter, myself and three teenage girls. Beautiful view of the beach and parasailing from our balcony. Close to everything. Large clean room with everything we needed from the kitchen facilities to the sofa which converted into a bed. Beautiful pools. You can order lunch and drinks right from you poolside lounge chair. The staff were very accomodating. The beach is very clean; the entire boardwalk area is clean. I would do it again tomorrow. Well worth it! A vacation you want to remember forever. The only negative thing I can think of is that I didn't notice any security people even though it seemed very safe. I highly recommend the QUALITY INN BOARDWALK.

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Trip Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: joliver41
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The staff was extremely knowledgable about the services of the hotel and the area. The room was very clean, spacious, and also comfortable. The hotel was conveniently located to EVERYTHING! i would defiunitely stay \here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “"Stay Away" Lots of Mold on the Front Door and Ceiling!”
Reviews.Author: DGBB
Reviews.Content: The Room was disgusting. Lots of MOLD on the door and ceiling. The wallpaper was peeling off the wall.The carpet was badly worn, ripped and stained with holes. The patio door only partially locked with a broken latch.The TV only worked on some channels.The bathroom was old and small with a worn, discolored paint chipped toliet seat , holes in the wall from a wall fixture which was not repaired and no sink stopper.I mean how much can a toliet seat cost?. Also the hook behind the bathroom door was caked with dust, rust and mold. The furniture was very dated and in poor shape with large scratches and dents. The pictures on the wall and TV screen all had a layer of dust on them our entire stay.The A/C control was hanging off the wall. In addition the service was TERRIBLE. When I asked about moving to another room I was told that there was nothing else available and that the GM would let me know if anything became available during our 4 night stay. Unfortunately nothing became available.Though I was able to book this hotel at a very attractive rate, this specific room should not be sold at ANY RATE. Some of the renovated rooms might be ok but this room needs to be taken out of inventory for an overhaul! The only good thing was the location which was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: OceanBeachLoverUsa
Reviews.Content: We checked out about 10 hotels in the area before we booked the Quality Inn. We loved it! The people who work there are so nice, and the rooms were great. Private balcony overlooking the ocean- we ate our breakfast there in the morning and relaxed there at night. Super comfy plush beds. The kitchen had a stove, full size fridge, coffee pot, microwave, dishwasher, and basic cooking items. The bathroom was nice and super clean. We also had a sitting area and cable TV. The pools are nice, one indoor and two outdoor, plus a kiddie pool and hot tub. The outdoor bar was nice, good pina coladas! Great for couples and families, we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A little old fashioned...”
Reviews.Author: ihatedopes
Reviews.Content: The rooms here need to be upgraded but otherwise, the view of the Ocean was great, and service was fine. Nice restaurant overlooking the boardwalk; I recommend breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: cschult
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect; right on the boardwalk and a quick walk or drive to all the great attractions. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Our room was clean and everything worked (there was even clean plates, silverware, and cooking utensils). The room service took care of the dishes as well. Overall everything was taken care of and the stay could not have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great until Price Switch at Checkout!~”
Reviews.Author: Geneseo04
Reviews.Content: Great location, decent hotel. However, when I checked out they increased the amount they charged me for the second night- after I paid for the nights already! Then there wasn't a manager on duty- poor business practices.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: PGHMTN
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at this great hotel. It is older but they have obviously put a lot of time, money and effort into making it the best it can be. We stayed at this same hotel 20 years ago, and the location is still fantastic and the upgrades they've put in are wonderful. The staff was outstanding ... something you always can appreciate when you're traveling and away from home. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay @ Very Good Rate”
Reviews.Author: TNMike1958
Reviews.Content: We were there for 1 night. The location is great, the service was outstanding. This hotel is a little dated but the amenities were very good for the rate we paid. Great ocean front room with kitchenette, located nicely on the boardwalk . It's all a family of 2-6 needs for a fun and cost saving vaction. 5 star hotel, it is not, but we will stay here everytime we are in the are.

Reviews.Title: “Off Season, You get what you pay for. I guess.”
Reviews.Author: SunshinyGal
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at Quility Inn OC boardwalk in October 08. I will start by telling you I love the Boardwalk. Our room was nice enough but my first complant was that they were doing constuction on the floor below us and the fumes of tar and glue were overwhelming, so much so that the cleaning lady put a towel down in front of our door so the smell would not creep in to the room. I appriecate her effort but it was useless. On the second night of our four night stay The fire alarm went off at 2:00 a.m. One thing the alarm never went off in our room. I heard the alarm and the other hotel guest leaving so i too left my room thinking there was a fire. After a 20 min stay outside we were let back in. There was no infomation to let us know if in fact there was a fire or not. Another guest let us know the next day that it was a pulled fire alarm. My grip with this is that the Hotel should have at least appologized for the incoveniance to there guest. The Pool Area needs to updated. Also Don't be fooled by the pictures of the game room and Fitness room. They are very Small.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a Major Update!!!”
Reviews.Author: AHHsunshine
Reviews.Content: Although the locaton was excellent right on the boardwalk, the room, which was an efficiency, looked like it hadn't had any updates for decades. Although the room seemed reasonably clean, the carpeting was worn, the furniture was old and chipped, the bathroom was small and there was some rust in several places. The grout in the bathtub area was messy. The housekeeping service was minimal during our stay - basically the beds were made and towels were replaced. We had to use styrofoam cups from the coffee maker in the lobby since no cups were replaced by housekeeping. The kitchenette actually had a 4 burner stove which I haven't seen in an efficiency for years. The best thing about the room was the fresh air we were able to bring in from the sliding glass door instead of using air conditioning. I was very surprised about the ratings I read about the property before I booked.

Reviews.Title: “Old section (oceanfront) rundown”
Reviews.Author: golddigger1
Reviews.Content: Should have listened to other reviews. If you want oceanfront insist on the NEW tower building which hopefully is better than the old section. We were on 6flr right where old and new sections were connected. Bathroom was disgusting. Wallpaper coming off the walls, ceiling panels about ready to fall down, mold around tub and sink, etc. etc......... Room itself was OK - carpet fairly clean and beds were comfortable.... First time we used toilet it refused to flush. Called desk and they had someone come up within 20 min. to fix it. The time we were there Ocean City got hit with high winds (50MPH gusts) and it was cold. The heat in the hotel wasn't on yet so it was pretty cold in the room. Called desk and they sent up 2 bed comforters right away. Even though our room wasn't the best by a long shot the service we got was very good.................... If you still want to stay here, with an oceanfront room, insist on the new tower and I would suggest that you look at the room before taking it.......

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Quality Inn Boardwalk!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pamelaanneMaryland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality Inn Boardwalk Hotel from September 8 through the 12. This was the first time I have ever stayed at this hotel. From the moment that I checked in I experienced nothing but good customer service!!!! Even though I stayed in the older section of the hotel, I had no complaints. The room was very clean, the beds were comfortable and the pillows were wonderful!!!! I had a problem with the lock on the front door of my room. Within minutes, Dave, the maintenance man came, corrected the problem and made sure that I was able to work the lock. The housekeeping staff was regular and extremely diligent. The location of this hotel was a bonus, being right on the boardwalk. The pools were clean. I cannot say enough about how nice this hotel was. Over the last twenty years, my family has stayed at many different hotels in Ocean City. I was a little leary after reading some of the reviews about this hotel which is why I am writing my own review. This hotel was a great place to stay and I would recommend it. The Quality Inn Boardwalk Hotel is now my favorite hotel in Ocean City and I can hardly wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: bellerose
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quality in for 5 days in August 2008. We had an ocean front room on the 5th floor in the newer section of the hotel. The room was very nice and clean, complete kitchen, comfortable beds, separate seating area with TV and VCR and chairs and table on the balcony. There are 2 pools outdoors and 1 indoor. The pools were very clean. There is complimenary coffee and fruit in the lobby and the staff was very friendly. We would definitely stay at the Quality Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “There's the good, then the bad”
Reviews.Author: Catrianna
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights over Labor Day weekend with our 4 children. Okay, to break it down, the location is great, we had an ocean view room, 2 double beds, pull out sofa, the room was clean all except for the carpet..yuck, and it was rumpled and I tripped twice. The door got stuck a lot which was irritating, I thought for sure we were going to be stuck in there one night! When you walk out the hotel lobby there are 2 outdoor pools and a bar, they're nice. Then you can walk right out to the boardwalk and the beach..again, nice. The indoor pool and hot tub were downright nasty, the hot tub was about room temparture, that's it, a lot of paint peeling and ended up in my swim suit...gross! The elevator rarely worked, we used the steps most of the time. Being on the 4th floor it wasn't too bad but still a pain. For the price, it was a decent room, then again we're used to staying in 5 star resorts in Florida, so my expectations were high. The location and outdoor amenities make it worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: surferdude3
Reviews.Content: hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, the room itself was wonderful.. i was on the 6th floor and couldnt have asked for a better view of the ocean. i definitely plan on returning next year

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: kclopper
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean but needs alot of work. When we arrived the air conditioner was on full blast and the room was very hot. The front desk sent someone to fix it and then it was just o.k. We would wake in the middle of the night because of the heat. The toilet was also "fixed" shortly after our arrival, but never did work right. The flusher handle just hung out of the toilet and every time you flushed you had to sort of push it back into place to flush. It eventually stopped flushing all together and rather than complain about it again we just removed the top lid and flushed it manually inside. The sliding glass door to the balcony was very hard to open and close. The pull out sofa bed mattress was about maybe 5 inches thick and full of springs that poked into your back and did not make for a good nights sleep although the regular beds were comfortable. The maid would bring fresh towels but that's about all she did. The pools and hot tub were nice but overall, we just expected more especially for what we had to pay. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay At This Hotel - There Are Much Better Hotels at this Rate”
Reviews.Author: iamloved
Reviews.Content: This is without question one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in but it was just as pricey as much nicer OC hotels. I needed a room at the last minute & went with the Quality Inn since it was a chain and I thought that it would offer a bare minimum standard of quality. I was wrong. The rooms are disgusting, gross, and dirty and look like they have not been updated in the last 40 years. The furniture was old and worn. The dressers were falling apart. The floor had spots. The bed linens were old, hard, and scratchy. Their were flies in the room. I was afraid to touch anything. I complained & the manager showed me a so-called renovated room. It was only a tad better. The hotel common areas are in poor condition. You are responsible for getting your own bags to your room on raggedy old carts on elevators that are barely functioning. The floors are not smooth so its hard to maneuver the cart. Quality Inn needs to tear this property down and start over. I lost all confidence in the brand after staying at this property and I would never stay at a Quality Inn again without doing advanced research.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Unassuming
Reviews.Content: Thte Quality Inn Boardwalk was so convenient for us. Two nice pools which were very well cleaned, daily, Aoom with a great view. Not only had a stove, full size refrigerator, micro, and dishwasher. Extra chairs provided for balcony, and a screen on sliding door to keep out bugs. Also, provided a VCR and Dvd player. It was conveniet to have a safe, and three phones. There is a Subway right next door for quick food and the indoor pool stays open to !:00 AM. The staff was courteos and helpful. Parts of the hotel need modernizing but all is clean. Would return and stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: montez34
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Quality Inn with four other families the week of July 5-12, 2008. We had five rooms and everyone loved their room in the Tower side of the hotel. We were on the 9th floor and the view was picture perfect. All the pools were great inside and outside. All our kids loved the place. We just walked right out of the hotel and the beach and boardwalk were right there, perfect. Everyone who worked at the hotel was very attentive. The people who worked the front desk were great. We can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “once they have your money they dont care”
Reviews.Author: ynotden
Reviews.Content: Positive first: close to Ocean Do not go there if you can stay any where else: No one that works there understands english they speak some but do not understand it Parking is bad 1800.00 a week for so called premium room had to park block away on good days Rooms are old carpet worn and dirty smelled like locker room They advertise High speed internet do not have it they have 5 "boxes " for the whole hotel and they are some kind of mickey mouse thing that plugs into the wall outlets took 3 days to wait on list to get one did not work at all. AC unit tried to work but gave up most days after a few hours so when hot part of day had to leave room Saddest part is no one cared tried on several ocasions to get help at desk was told did not have any one that could help at that time they could not leave desk Little things like broken closet doors, toilet seat, Door to room had to use shoulder block to open just added to the total week long disapointment. The last needle in eye was they put little flyers in room saying you must be 100 % satasaction and if they cant correct they will not charge What a joke I saved one to remind me in case I would ever consider another stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Disney-Addict1208
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quality Inn for a weekend at the end of June. Check in was quick. Hallways were very dirty, but it is the beach and with so much foot traffic, it's understandable. Our room could have been a little cleaner, but after staying at some of the other places on the boardwalk in Ocean City, I've realized that this hotel is not bad at all. We had an Ocean Front Suite and really enjoyed the views of the boardwalk and ocean. We had to shut our sliding doors at night due to the noise from parties in surrounding rooms, but that is probably true of any boardwalk hotel in Ocean City. This hotel exits right onto the boardwalk, unlike some other hotels where you have to walk through a business, such as dairy queen, in order to get onto boardwalk. I really liked the location on 16th street, as the beach didn't seem to get as crowded as 1st - 10th streets.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a room in the renovated section of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: noftsinger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Inn Boardwalk as a group for a lacrosse tournament. We were in the lower part of the hotel and it was in pitiful shape. Our room was in poor condition. The air conditioner did not work. The sad thing is we paid $256 a night and in all honesty could not sleep as the conditions were so poor. Some of the families stayed in the tower. Those rooms were much nicer. If you have to stay here ask for the renovated rooms. The holiday inn next door was much nicer and the same price. We will stay there next year.

Reviews.Title: “New Management and it shows !”
Reviews.Author: belgiumusa
Reviews.Content: There is a new wind blowing through the Quality Inn in Ocean city and it shows! We had a great time and were very pleased to see the new renovations that had been done. The inside pool is now very inviting and great fun with the hot tub to relax in. The rooms couldn’t be better. Nice white ironed sheets and light colored tops , so fresh and clean. The bad rooms the same, fluffy white towels and the kitchen has everything you need ,even a dish washer. The staff couldn’t have been more helpful and friendly. You can see that there is now a new Manager that is now running the hotel like it should be run! We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spot on the OC Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: tracyvb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Quality Inn Boardwalk with my husband and young son (toddler) for a nice family get-a-way long weekend. The hotel location was perfect...right on the boardwalk, oceanfront with great views! The room was very clean, and the beds & pillows were extremly comfortable (ultra plush!!). The staff was very attentive and courteous and really took care of us. My son loved swimming in the indoor pool - which was nice and warm on such a cold-day (outside) in March. We ate one meal at the onsite restaurant...and the food was really good, with a great selection. While this hotel is an older hotel (as most are in this area of OC), they are making really nice upgrades and the rooms were big, comfy, and clean!!

Reviews.Title: “Got what was expected”
Reviews.Author: joenavy
Reviews.Content: the good location location location right on the board walk great ocean view great pool view reasonable price the not so good un-remodeled room a real struggle to get the patio door open tacky kitchen tacky bathroom no fan to clear out steam bathroom door hard to shut hard to open overall tacky room but the price and and views override it would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Stay In The Tower Building If You Stay Here!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: runnerchickum
Reviews.Content: O.K I stayed here in the summer with my family, we stayed in the tower building our room was great everything up to date. I could not understand why people were doggin the place WELL NOW I KNOW we stay in the lower building it was yuck yuck!! I would have been extremely disappointed if I stayed in that part of the hotel in the summer with the money we paid. Thank god we stayed here when it was only $9.00 (customer appreciation month)because our room was worth only $9 bucks. A mouse could have squeezed through our front door because it did not close properly. You had to kick the front door to make sure it was shut. the bathroom was GROSS mold, chip paint, rust etc., plus the water did not go down the tub so when you took a shower you practically swam in the water. So if you decide to stay here request the TOWER BUILDING much much better. They said the where remodeling the lower building but I did not see anyone remodeling it. Ok well have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: luvmytravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family at the Quality Inn Boardwalk over Thanksgiving. When I arrived, the clerk upgraded my room to an oceanview. The room itself was large enough for the 5 of us. It contained a kitchen area, which was nice for preparing a few dishes that I hadn't already prepared for Thanksgiving dinner. The kids went to the indoor pool almost immediately, which is always a favorite thing for them to do. As they did, I went to check out the exercise room (which is adjacent) and found out that they had all new equipment. Needless to say, I had to try it out. Really nice. I also liked the T.V. they put in there to watch while you work out. The sauna was closed, probably for repairs. It appears that they have been trying to update the hotel. What they have updated is very nice. They added a 24-hour coffee service in the lobby area. Also available were morning papers and some fruit. I believe these were also added since the last time I had been there. The staff was very friendly and everyone I passed said hello. There are areas of the hotel that are still being renovated, but personally, I had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a dive”
Reviews.Author: eclipsed00d
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Thanksgiving weekend 2007, The ceiling had paint chipped off of it. The chair was broken, the carpet was dirty. The shower head in the bathroom was need of repair. The outdoor pool needed repair(it was the off season) and you could see where paint is chipped off of it. I give it 2 srars

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Ocean City's Most Treasured Gem...the Quality Inn Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: holiday17
Reviews.Content: My recent stay was very pleasant and enjoyable. I am very disappointed in those who wrote bad reviews about one of Ocean City's five original hotels which started the Motel Row era in the early 1950's. I am an absolute HUGE fan of this hotel and my family has been staying here since 1987. Yes, the hotel is in need of much comestic TLC inside and out, but fighting the salt from the ocean is a very difficult task. The Premium Efficiency we had stayed in was very clean and nice and on the 6th floor overlooking the kidney shaped pool and boardwalk. The Oceanview American Grille was great! The breakfast buffet had everything imaginable...eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, etc. On site, there is a Bike & Surrey rental area. Great times! This is a must do when staying at the Quality Inn Boardwalk. Stay here and you won't be disappointed. The Quality Inn Boardwalk offers the best hospitality on the boards...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Cortee123
Reviews.Content: Like some others, I was a little concerned about staying at the QI after reading some of the reviews (I had already booked my room), especially the one which said that there were "bugs" in the room. However, we were pleasantly surprised when we got to the room. Yeah, the room could use a little updating, but overall, the accomodations were good. Our housekeeper, Brittany, was such a sweet young girl and so very helpful. The maintenance staff was right on the money when we called after having a problem with our lock. I went with my mother and sons, and it is a good hotel if you are traveling with children. My kids loved both the indoor and outdoor pools, and I loved the fact that we could walk right out the back door to the beach. The pool bar was a nice touch, too! I saw not one bug whatsoever when I was there (thank GOD!). When there was a billing problem at checkout, it was taken care of immediately. I also liked the fact that there were two parking lots so parking was never an issue. The QI is a good place to stay if you are traveling with young children and do not want to spend an arm and a leg on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: tziporshir
Reviews.Content: Just returned from several days' stay at the QI, which was for the most part delightful. I was very pleasantly surprised. After reading several reviews here, I was concerned. Called and requested to be placed in the renovated part of the hotel. Fortunately, a room became available. There's a $20/night "premium" cost differential, but from what I read it was well worth it. This isn't the most luxurious hotel I've ever stayed in, but it doesn't pretend to be. The efficiency suite was spacious and well-equipped, and the bed was probably the most comfortable I've ever slept in away from home. Soft pillows and down duvet; felt like sleeping in clouds. As for location, the QI is excellent. On the boardwalk; walking distance to the pier, etc. (if you enjoy a walk; otherwise, you can always catch a tram), but away from the constant activity of the lower area. And the hotel staff were gracious and helpful. On the down side, the elevators are annoyingly slow, and there isn't enough parking in the main lot. But the overflow lot is just across the street. On the whole, I was pleased with my experience, and would definitely be happy to stay at the QI again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: travel2mom
Reviews.Content: Arrived 8/19 for 5 nights hotel is in GREAT NEED of a remodel. For the price I paid here I could have had two suites in Myrtle Beach that would have been clean. Bathroom hasn't had an upgrade since the 60's or 70's and the lock on the window was broken. The kitchen in the room was recently redone and stood out in a dingy room. Lock was also loose on sliding doors to balcony. The rugs in the room made your feet black - - - you couldn't even take your shoes off. Springs on the edge of the sofa bed where my daughter and her friend slept were either missing or hanging off. DEFINITELY NO QUALITY HERE !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, moldy, rusty and run down”
Reviews.Author: jayceelei
Reviews.Content: We thought this would be a nice place to stay because of the location, but it wasn't worth it! By far, one of the nastiest places that I've ever stayed at and it was over $200 a night (holiday weekend). The ceiling paint is peeling over top the bed, mold on the bathtub, the toilet doesn't stop running, bathroom tiles are missing, curtains are ripped and stained with rust, the wallpaper edges are curled and the finish on the furniture has completely rubbed off. If you do decide to stay here, I would recommend bringing several cans of Lysol. We asked for another room when we arrived and the front desk said that all the rooms were the same. That's a scary thought!

Reviews.Title: “Probably not again”
Reviews.Author: ShadowPotter
Reviews.Content: First of all I think most of these properties are just waiting to be bought up knocked down. Reading some books in the room I'm getting the impression they are trying to turn OCMD into a luxury resort. Everything new they are building you'll be paying no less than $400 a night (in season) for a hotel and if it's a condo, not less than $1 million. I am very disappointed in what they are turning Ocean City into. Now where is the average middle income person supposed to go. Now for my review. We had a premium OF efficiency supposedly remodeled last 3-4 years. Of course there were check in problems. The person who had the room before us they had never checked out so we could not check in until they were checked out. Of course no managers on site to help with the issue. Waited about 20 minutes til a manager finally showed up. Like I said before, I believe these managers are just waiting for an offer on properties. We had to call maintenance fo fix the sliding screen door. Well that was useless. Every time we opened/close it went off track. Someone started peeling the wall paper on the one wall. From our floor you could see sand in the pools. They did not vacuum the pools the one day. Yeah they have cabinets in the kitchen but they are filled with dishes & glassess. There is one cabinet you could use to put stuff in but its above the frige and you have to be 7 feet tall to reach into it. But the best part was finding someone else's shoes in our room from a previous stay. They really could use some new cleaning people. I was afraid to look under the beds before we checked out. Overall $300 (including tax) it was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: mrs1weed
Reviews.Content: Usually at Ocean City we stay across the bay at cottages but decided to hit the boardwalk for the convenince of our 16 year old & friend. The web is very decieving! When 1st walking into the room we decided they had remodeled 10-15 years ago & took the video then. The room was not sparkling, missing a closet door, all mirrors/ windows were not clean. Sorry now as reading other reviews that I did not move immediatly. We were not in the towers but not sure they would be THAT much better. The second day my husband killed a roach but they decided not to tell me until the way home because I never would have stepped foot in room again! The day we left we were doing a room sweep to be sure we had everything & I do not want to even tell you what we found under the bed! Bath drawers had old razors, tampons, etc in- COME ON PEOPLE, it is not that difficult to CLEAN a room! I think all the maids do is take out trash & give you fresh towels. Never ever again would I stay here. The pool was the great & bike rentals right out front was convenient, hotel is disguisting! Never again.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is...”
Reviews.Author: liznj
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night, 5 day vacation at the Quality Inn Boardwalk. Check-in was smooth, we arrived late (around 6pm) and got up to our room. I booked an Oceanfront Efficiency with two double beds. The exterior of the hotel did have a little wear and tear, which is usual for a beachfront property, salt water air tears through paint. It definetely could use a touch up of paint and hole patch up. Our front door looked a little weak, they could use new doors on the exterior access rooms. When I got inside the room I was pleasantly surprised, it was NOT a total disaster. Full sized refrigerator, 4 burner stove/oven, dish washer, sink, cabinets with utensils, plates, pots and pants were there and clean. There was a table and chairs, toaster and coffee maker. The beds were comfortable, sheets nice and soft. The carpet is UGLY and the curtains were UGLY but hey, i don't care about that. There was a pullout couch and a table in the sitting area. The TV was old, so you can't hookup a portable DVD player to it so that was kinda a let down. The bathroom was very small and the drop ceiling needs to be replaced. The water pressure in the toilet the first day was very low but after talking with a few locals sometimes the water pressure in Ocean City isn't that great. So if you stay here, don't do the multiple flush right away -- flush once. Didn't work? WAIT 2-3 minutes and then try again. After the first night, the pressue was normal and we didn't have to deal with multiple flushing. The balcony door could use some WD-40 but there was a small table outside with two chairs and a towel bar on the wall. There was a great ocean view, also a great view of the two pools. The outdoor pools were awesome (indoor pool was ugly and over chlorinated, stay outside), the poolbar is great, they had awesome happy hour specials and a friendly staff. This bar is popular at night as people walking down the boardwalk will stop here for a drink. It is a LOOOONG walk to the Pier -- take the tram. We had a great housekeeper (Erika) who kept our room immaculate!! So overall it was not dirty, smelly or roach infested. It was clean and comfortable with basic amenities. The staff is super friendly, at least to me they were! We didn't have a problem with parking or anything. Keep in mind its busy season, so there are A LOT of people in Ocean City, VERY crowded, get up early to get a pool chair!! Photos coming soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like whats on the websight!”
Reviews.Author: ocmdlover
Reviews.Content: For something different, I took my daughter and her friends here for her birthday last February. I chose this particular hotel since it was listed as having numerous appealing amenities we could use since swimming in the ocean was not an option. However, upon arrival I was quite disappointed. Considering were were paying $100 per night for a room in the off season I thought we would get something decent. Our room was adequate but in need of a facelift. In fact the entire hotel could use a makeover. I was also very disapponted to find that both the sauna and exercise room were under renovation and unusable. It would have been nice to know this before booking the room. They did have an indoor resturant but they were closed on Sun. and only open for dinner on Sat. Not to mention it had a very barlike atmosphere. On the upside,,,we were on the oceanfront/boardwalk and could enjoy a gorgeous view.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: caddy1958
Reviews.Content: In a classic line "What a Dump." The inside pool and hot tub are filthy. The bathroom we used to change in when we arrived was small and dirty and smelly. There is not enough parking for the amount of rooms. I am handicapped and there were only 4 spaces. I never got one once while I was down there. The rooms are dirty, especially the floor. My son's white socks were black after walking a few minutes on the rug in our room. The electronice keys for the room almost never worked. It isn't worth the money. The only thing good about it was it was on the boardwalk, but I'd rather walk a few blocks than stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Quality Inn Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: sac2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quality Inn Boardwalk earlier this week and found it to be a very satisfactory hotel. The hotel is not as new, as nice, or as popular as the Holiday Inn and Suites next door, but is not nearly as expensive either. We stayed in a recently renovated room in the tower building, which was well worth the extra money. The room was clean, spacious, and reasonably priced. The hotel has two large outdoor pools and is in a good location. The staff members are exceptionally friendly and made both the check in and check out processes easy and quick. The only two things about this hotel that I could find to complain about are that the elevators are slow and that the indoor pool area has seen its better days. We were very pleased with this hotel and wouldn't hesitate recommending it to others. Just be sure to ask for a Premium (newly renovated) room in the tower building.

Reviews.Title: “Double check the cleanliness of the room”
Reviews.Author: xingtaopeyton
Reviews.Content: My husband, 11 year old & 1 1/2 year old daughters and I scheduled only 1 nights stay at Quality Inn Boardwalk. We had read the reviews on this website prior to leaving for our trip and were worried about what our room was going to look like since it was too late to cancel without being charged. Once we arrived, the first glance of our room was wonderful. A little warm in the room, but we found a window that was left open and this trip was during a heat wave. It cooled off to a comfortable level once the window was shut. There was no lock on this window. We had a room with a partial view of the ocean, which was beautiful and access to our room was only from the outside of the hotel. This was a non renovated room. The beds were comfortable and there was more than enough room for all 4 of us. We had two tv's, a curtain to seperate the sleeping quarters if needed, which was broken, a sink, microwave, dishes & utensils and fridge/freezer, two double beds and a sofa bed. There were no bugs. After closer scrutiny however, I found that the room wasn't cleaned very well. But still found no signs of any bugs. Under the beds we found food that was there from someone else's stay. There was some bottle caps in the corners by the trash can and we even found a football behind the sofa-bed. I'm glad I found this mess upon leaving the hotel the next day, or I wouldn't have been able to sleep there. The bathroom was clean, however we only had HOT water. So only the first person in the shower had a comfortable one. The water would get too hot to stand under after that, unless we waited for it to cool off between showers. The outdoor pools were nice, but so chlorinated that my girls' eyes were burning. My older daughter had to wear her goggles in the pool, and my youngest, well she just didn't go under the water. We didn't try out the indoor pool. The staff was nice and courteous. After we checked in they helped us unload the car and placed everything in our room for us. We didn't stop at the restaurant to eat during our stay, but did notice that it's next to the indoor pool area, which made the restaurant very warm. I would actually stay again, but this time I would check everything out first and have the room cleaned again if needed. There's no reason for a room of that size to NOT be clean. Finding sand in the carpeting is understandable, considering the location of this hotel, but someone else's left overs is not. If the non renovated was set up so nicely, I can only imagine how wonderful the new rooms are, as long as they're clean! We're planning on another weekend trip this year, hopefully we'll get a clean room with some cold water, renovated or not. Being this a touristy place, I believe some of the other comments about this hotel didn't keep that in mind, but only concentrated on the cost of the room instead of the location. It is a beautiful location on the boardwalk. The ocean is a wonderful sight and there's a trolly the goes up & down the boardwalk which will stop anywhere along the way for you. Overall, I'm not disappointed in my stay, I only slept in the room, the rest of our visit we were outside enjoying the scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, Moldy, Damp and Disgustingly Repulsive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent one weekend night here. The room was literally dripping damp. Everything that sat in it for more than an hour became damp. It was very run down. We opted to sleep in our vehicle for fear of what might be set to scurrying after dark. DO NOT BOOK HERE. UNLESS YOU ARE A BUG, YOU WILL BE EXTREMELY DISSATISFIED.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: Betty59
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location. That's what you get with the Boardwalk Quality Inn. It's steps from the beach and boardwalk at Ocean City, MD. If you have kids or teenagers that get easily distracted there's lots for them to do close by. They can walk on the boardwalk, get a bite to eat, swim in the pool or go to the beach easily without you having to drive them all around. The Boardwalk Quality Inn has three pools, two outdoor and one indoor, and a pool bar that serves cocktails, sodas, burgers, chicken fingers and hotdogs. The hotel staff is friendly and efficient and willing to help in any way they can. There is a newer section and a much older section of the hotel. If you ask for the AAA rate or get a discount of some kind, you may end up in the older part of the hotel. However, the rooms are clean and neat. They are stocked with plenty of towels and free stuff like shampoo, conditioner, lotion, shower caps, etc. Our room was fairly large with a sleeper sofa and two TV's with cable service, but the sleeper sofa was old and uncomfortable. Wireless internet service is available in the lobby. The air conditioning worked great which is more than I can say for the new Holiday Inn next door which seemed to have people complaining about their air conditioning every time we walked in there. The Quality Inn could invest in newer sheets and blankets as some were very worn. The exercise room was basic with a universal gym, plus a couple of bikes and a couple of treadmills. There was no arcade for the kids even though some internet sites said they had one. The hotel does have a tanning salon, hot tub, changing room, laundry room and sauna. The restaurant is open for breakfast and dinner. It is closed for lunch, but there is a Subway on the corner and tons of other places to eat nearby. The Quality Inn rate at $220 plus was more reasonable compared to the newer hotels like the Holiday Inn and the brand new Hilton, both of which range from $300-$430 a night, before taxes, during peak season. Be prepared for sticker shock in Ocean City, Maryland as even the older hotels on the boardwalk are around $175-$299 a night range during peak season. Given the reasonable rates, amenities and closeness to the beach, I would recommend the Boardwalk Quality Inn. It was booked solid every night we were there with families and people of all ages. I can't wait to go back to Ocean City and I'll stay at the Quality Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “discusting”
Reviews.Author: brianasmom
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for here but did not stay... checked in... went to room...it was discusting... looked like it was from the 50's.... went into bathroom... wallpaper coming off walls and BLOOD on towels.... pictures on their website were very deceiving! So we checked out and thankfully did not get charged and went next door to the Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Suits the needs of a place to sleep at night and pop in & out of during the day”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family has been staying at this hotel for 10 plus years, since I was young. Through the years they have renavated here and there but some of the rooms still need work. The front desk is more than happy to attend to any problems ie. door lock not working right, sliding door off the track, not enought towels sometimes. It is a perfect hotel to stay in if you plan to be very busy during the daytime on the beach and boardwalk, and going out to restaurants and mini gold at night. It suits the needs of my family (we usually get a room that splits to fit 6 people) and we come back every year. The hotel is right on the boardwalk with 2 outdoor pools that are always active with people and an inside one that i tend to stay away from because there is always little kids in it. The hotel is great if you like to go on the boardwalk but like to be away from the noisy nightlife that tends to happen down towards the other end of the boardwalk. The beach out front is always clean so is the inside of the hotel. I have been going there for 10 plus years and have NEVER seen a "cockroach" or any bug in the hotel rooms. There is a great little bar out front too by the pool that is active for young people You get what you pay for, and for this hotel, being on the boardwalk, beach access, 3 pools, restaurants nearby everywhere, this is a good hotel. Ocean front view is wonderful. If you are looking to stay in the whole time and watch t.v. and sleep all day i would not say this is the hotel for you. It definately lacks in luxury, but its Ocean City, not sunny Florida!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Infested with Roaches”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As the title states, this hotel is indeed infested with roaches. Back in August 2005, my family spent their third year in a row at this hotel. The year before we got the same room as the year before that, but we noticed that year that the room was much older and the trimming around the bed was being torn off. Though I may be the young daughter of the family of five, the Quality Inn was only hated by me. My parents love it since it gives a great view of the ocean and boardwalk. Sure, it may be nice to see all the bikes passing by in the morning, but later in the day it become riff-raff and touristy. The beds were okay in my room, but the sheets were sort of stiff. One of the things that I hated was that our television lacked a remote control. We have asked the manager countless times for a remote for the television, but appearently they said that tourists must have stole it on their vacation and they do not have back-ups. The outdoor pools were very poorly made; no lifeguards were hired and children could easily unattach pool dividers and play around with them. The tourists are very rude there, too. Every morning, they would lay their beach towels out on the chairs near the pool so then they can "reserve" their spot. DO NOT GO INTO THE INDOOR POOL. Sure, it does look sort of nice with the fake greenery placed around it, but the clorine horribly damages the hair. The food at the little mini cabana bar was very pricy for very little. This hotel is infested with roaches, thus the title of this review "this hotel is infested with roaches". During my previous stay there, we have found two roaches living in the hotel. If you find one, you're bound to find more. One of the roaches was on my mom's bed. It was pretty ignorable. The other roach was on the curtain that split the TV room from the bedroom/mini kitchen. Eww... Overall, I would not go here. Instead, think about the Holiday Inn next door, the Grand, the Capri, the Golden Sands, and there was another one that I heard about that I can't remember the name of.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 sons and I stayed at this hotel last summer, during peak season. We're staying there again this summer. The hotel is older, and some of the rooms are in need of updating. The oceanfront room we stayed in was a little out of date, but was clean and provided everything a family on vacation might need: 2 double beds, pull out sofa bed, microwave, fridge, stove, pots, dishes, silverware, TV, DVD player, pools, beach access, boardwalk access, etc. We stayed in an oceanfront room that overlooked one of the outdoor pools, and the boardwalk, of course. The oceanfront balconies are nice and spacious. The actual rooms are quite spacious as well. This location of this hotel (17th street) is ideal for us. It's right on the Boardwalk and only 17 blocks from the rides and amusement area. Our family walked down to the rides nightly. The pools are nice. The water level in the indoor pool was always low during our visit, and it seems the pool itself could use a little help. But, we enjoyed it. The 2 outdoor pools are gorgeous and provide pleanty of chairs/loungers for sunbathing or sitting to read a book. The service was wonderful, and the laundry maching use is free, even during peak season. Just ask the front desk staff for tokens.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn Boardwalk
HotelInfo.Address: 1601 Atlantic Ave., Ocean City, MD 21842
